description:
Simple mod that gives extra options for how long the Mercenary Contracts last. Bodyguard contracts go up to 7 days now, and outpost guards can last up to 30.

Cost per day stays the same as normal, so it's simply a matter of convenience so you don't have to constantly re-hire them.

I can make them go as high as you want. So if you want even longer contracts, just ask. Hope you enjoy! :)
author: Shidan

description:
Adds the Islanders as a playable race, wandering recruits, their own factions, and new settlements. Unique weapons, clothing, and armour, are also included, and can be obtained from appropriate vendors.

"A unique race of men residing primarily on islands and along the Eastern coast. Due to long-term exposure to the acidic oceans, their skin is dyed either a faint blue or red and their hair bleached white. Islander culture and society revolves around simple philosophies and a strict code of honour. Thus, they focus mainly on honing their swordsmanship and spirituality."

-Faster Heal Rate

author: Petrus.91

description:
This mod expands the Vagrant camps that can be found in the Great Desert. The following features are added by this mod:

Recruitable Peasants: Talk to a peasant to have a chance of recruiting them. It refreshes every 6 in-game hours, so if it doesn't work the first time you can try again later.

Dealers: Dealers can be found in any vagrant encampment. They sell crude weaponry, drugs, alchohol, and whatever meager scraps of food can be scrounged up. If you're a wanderer who's down on their luck and needs a quick fix or a bite to eat, these would be the people to look out for. They also rarely have some basic resources for construction, though never all that much at once. Also, they can do plastic surgery. Just hope the scalpel is clean.

Militiamen: Militiamen are rare vagrants who are a little stronger than normal, and act as the unofficial guards of encampments. They likely won't nearly be enough for serious threats, but if a drifter or some wild animal starts trouble, they'll probably be able to take care of it. They can also heal wounded people, so it might be a smart idea to get on their good side.

Vagrant Cities: While not actual cities, these places are camps of vagrants that are far larger than the normal ones. They don't have anything the smaller encampments don't have, but at the same time there's more stuff in general, and more guards around. If you've gotta lie low somewhere and the cities won't take you, these are probably your best option.

New spawn areas: Vagrant camps and cities can now be found in the Skimsands, Hook, the Unwanted Zone, and the Great Desert.

A "harsher" version of my Pocket Change mod, adding cats and string of cats to the inventories of practically every NPC in the game. Characters will be holding scraps of loose change compared to the original mod, making it more compatible with any economic overhaul mods or for the sake of reducing one's source of Cats. "Specialist" characters like food producers, traders, and diplomats no longer have obscene amounts of money.

Compared to the original mod characters will hold 45-80% less Cats. For example, The Holy Lord Phoenix had 200k Cats in his inventory using the original mod while in this version he has between 3350 Cats. The varied Samurai and Paladins of the UC and Holy Nation hold anywhere from 100 to 250 Cats, bandits and vagrants in the meagre range of 12-35 Cats.

It is recommended to have only one of my mods running at a time, so that the inventory changes do not conflict with one another.
author: Benishe323

description:
This mod removes all weather effects visually like rain, dust storms, ash, and fog. It keeps the mechanics like wind speed for wind generators, and combat penalties for fighting in a dust storm. I made this for myself because I have a very low end PC and decided to share with others who need the small FPS bump.

Updated: Version 98.23
author: Underfall00

description:
There are imho two types of ruins in the game. 

Ancient ruins and recent/modern ruins.

The ancient ruins belong to ancient factions like The Second Empire. The modern ruins belong to current factions were mostly often destroyed during the recent wars. 

This mod allows you to buy and restore most of these modern ruins.

[b]FAQ: [/b]

[i]Can I build outside the ruins?[/i]
No this mod only makes the ruined buildings available for sale

[i]Why did the loot inside the building disapear after I bought it?[/i]
Like with normal purchases after buying a building everything that is inside of the building gets removed.

[i]Why can I no longer buy ruins that belong to faction X?[/i]
Are you perhaps at war with that faction? You can not buy buildings from faction that is hostile towards you.

description:
Enables Attack Slots x3 

A simple mod that changes the base attack slots.
Vanilla game has it set to 1, so only one on one combat is possible.
This version is set to two. so three NPCs or players can attack the same target.

Load order should be at the top of the list when you enable this Mod. this way it will override any mod, including my own that change this base attack slots.

this does not make the game easier. it will make it harder.
x3 makes soloing a  difficult challenge.

author: Non

description:
[quote]
[h1]UPDATED TO VERSION 3 - SEPT 8[/h1]
Changes:
- Revert stealth stats for metal and chainmail based armors back to vanilla values
- Remove armor/blueprints from vanilla vendors
- Added custom traders (Rogue Traders) selling the armor/blueprints in most town/village
- Applied [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1597882779]Minor Mesh Fixes[/url] to all Mediocre Black Armor variants
- Merge timor1234's [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710644028]Patch for Fixing Clipping[/url] as part of main mod

Coming next:
- Rework all armor/clothing textures to make it a little brighter
- Release reworked textures in stages over the next week
- Possible alternative version for those who prefer current black armor texture (if there is demand for it)
[/quote]

[h1]ABOUT THIS MOD[/h1]
Existing armor mediocrely painted black. The stats are the same as vanilla with just a hint of Stealth multiplier where applicable.

[h1]WHAT'S INCLUDED[/h1]
70+ body armor, hats, helmet, mask, pants and boots in mediocre black variant. Covers almost all purchasable armor plus a few clothing as well.

[h1]IS IT CRAFTABLE?[/h1]
Yes. The armors follow same crafting recipe and machine as vanilla ones. Blueprints sold by Rogue Traders.

[h1]HOW TO GET THE ARMOR/BLUEPRINT[/h1]
As of Version 3, the armor/blueprints are no longer puchaseable at vanilla shops. They're now sold by Rogue Traders all over the map.

[h1]WHAT ARE THE ROGUE TRADERS AND WHERE TO FIND THEM[/h1]
Rogue Traders are custom traders selling Mediocre Black Armor armor/blueprints. There's at least one of them in most town/village. Major towns can have up to two Rogue Traders in it.

They usually hang out at the bar. If the bar is full or there is no bar in the town/village, you'll see them wandering around the place, getting in and out of buildings looking shady AF. They can be pretty hard to spot sometimes because they're wearing all black.

A word of advice: If you're tempted to attack the Rogue Traders, please don't. They're pretty deadly and they're not quite...human.



[h1]CREDIT[/h1]
Version 3 includes timor1234's [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710644028]Patch for Fixing Clipping[/url] as part of the mod. Thank you to timor1234 for making the patch and for his permission to include it in this update.

[quote]
As of Version 3, the patch is part of Mediocre Black Armor. However the patch only covers armor/clothing included in Mediocre Black Armor. You will still need his main [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1678049479]Fixing Clipping Issues{/url] mod if you want to fix overlap/clipping meshes for vanilla armor/clothing.[/quote]

description:
Ever notice how you can research improvements to your crossbow turrets, and wonder to yourself "Wow, if only I could improve the efficiency of my mines instead."? Say no more!

This mod addresses that by introducing a decently sized collection of technologies between tech levels 1 and 5, which can enhance anything ranging from the speed at which you research to the speed at which you produce weapons and armour!

The prices of each upgrade is reasonable in my opinion, but feel free to suggest changes. In general, each building can be improved by up to 25% in productivity, with the exception of stone and iron refineries (though this may change) and perhaps something or another I missed.

This does not touch any other gameplay features or mechanics. It simply upgrades the productivity of vanilla buildings. 

If theres something I haven't mentioned that I missed or something weird here or there, let me know. Otherwise, enjoy!

description:
Ever wanted to be able to train up my melee defense in a more realistic way? Want to give yourself a fighting chance early on? Or just want to beat up your freinds?

Well now you can!

With Sparing Mats, you can train your melee defense up to 20!
NEW: Now you there is a seperate sparring mat that you can use to train up your martial arts up to 20!
NOTE: In the build menu it will say that it trains up to level 42, but don't worry, once you build it and click on it, it will say it only trains up to 20. This is because of some sort of bug with the FCS. 

Also, adds Martial Arts Sparring Mat that trians up to level 10! I don't reccommend using it up to level 10, as I think Martial Arts training should be hard, but people really wanted it, so here it is.

Due to the limitations of FCS I can't make it require 2 people in order to train a character's melee defense, but I can make it go a lot slower without 2 people. I'll leave it up to you whether you want it to be immersive or not.
author: Space_lettuce

description:
This mod is dedicated to filling out the areas left lacking by the dev's world reaction systems. Be it adding effects to locations and factions that got none, or adding more detail to certain vanilla ones.

Now includes a world state checking character in Waystations to help with debugging issues with world states triggering. As well as a charatcer spawner to find those bugged NPCS, map to it also at Waystation bars.

Notable effects include:

-Dust Bandits having a civil war over leadership if the Dust King is taken down. Occupying nearby ruins for their HQs, and starting to have fights in the wilderness with each other. Taking down all the upstart leaders will cause the Dust Bandits to disband entirely.

-Mongrel and other locations falling to the Fogmen in certain conditions. Your actions have consequences, and sometimes the innocent will suffer due to them regardless of your intentions.

-The Western Hive going crazy if their Queen is kidnapped. They will be pushed forward by the sole drive of rescuing her, and will not have any mercy if anyone should stand in their way.

-Rebuilding The Hub under the Shek Kingdom if their forces take either Bad Teeth or Stack from the Holy Nation. Including some dialog to help guide the player on how exactly to advance from stage to stage of the repairs. Plans for rebuilding under the Holy Nation as well, once I get their conquest of the Shek in.

-Cannibals have been separated into up to 17 warring tribes. As each tribal leader is defeated they are absorbed into one of two larger more powerful tribes. If both large tribes reach full power they will launch a massive war against each other. If all chiefs are defeated, only scattered remnants will be left.

-The HN's last struggles for survival. After taking out their leaders you will be met regualr raids from the remnants of the HN, who have gathered around some new leaders of their own in hidden locations. There are bread crumbs out in the world to help you track down these new leaders, and until you do the raids will continue to strike you, no matter where you live. Once you wipe out the High Priest and his men though, the Holy Nation will be gone for good.

-The Shek rebuilding their empire in the event of success in their conflicts. Towns, villages, and outposts sprouting from the ruins in their area, as long as nobody else is around to hinder their work.

-(Coming Soon(tm)) Rebuilding the faction of Deadcat and reclaiming the Cannibal Plains after they've been cleared from cannibals.

If those sound like the kinds of things you'd be interested in, then welcome aboard. Make sure you import when adding to an existing save. Hope you enjoy! :)

[b]Note: You should probably put this mod as low as possible in the load order, near the bottom of the list to ensure it loads last or close to it. Bugs have been known to occur when loaded before other mods that edit world data, due to the nature of how town locations are stored in the files.[/b]

prd has made an excellent expansion to this mod, further tweaking and adding world states and effects. You can check it out here: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1688854241

This mod is NOT compatible with Living World. It touches enough of the same things to break several things, and has been known to trigger some of my overrides when they normally shouldn't. Use both at your own risk!

Russian Translation:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1671699248

[i]Image courtesy of Taragoth[/i]

Looking for a place to discuss Kenshi or Kenshi modding? Feel free to join the [url=https://discord.gg/kenshi]Kenshi Community Discord[/url] We're always welcome to new faces. :)

description:
Prisoners are no longer alive without food. 
However, give them food is a troublesome task
This mod resolves this problem.
You need Research "Imprisonment" to buid Dip Barrel.
Sloppy Strawflour Juice is made of 10 Strawflours and 40 Greenfruits, or Cactuses.
It has 5,000 nu, but very heavy, large and awful taste.
Prevent your prisoners starving.

囚人だって食料がなけりゃ生きていけなくなってしまった。
しかし、食べ物の受け渡しは面倒だ。
このmodなら面倒事を解決さ！
檻の研究が済んでいればDip Barrelが建築できる。
Sloppy Strawflour Juice（ゲロ粉）は麦粉10、野菜またはサボテン40で制作できる。
ゲロ粉は栄養価5,000と非常に高いが、クソみたいに重くてバカみたいにデカい。
食料だし重いから筋トレにも使えるけど、そこはKenshiの良心に任せる。
だってこれ、名前の通りやばいくらい不味い。
ダストウィッチの方がマシだし、奴隷だってもっと良い物食ってる。。
ただまあ、これで囚人も飢えないで済むね。
author: Kenshi Animal Park

description:
Make flashier fight by making AI use more varied moves and attack faster.

- Enabled all weapon moves for all weapon types, including martial art moves for armed combat.
- Changed a lot of attack animation min and max trigger range. They should use more varied moves, but also probably miss more. 
- Close range martial art moves like low kick and punches max trigger range reduced for armed combatant so that the character would use their weapon unless they are very close. 
- long range attack like heavy down cut or jump kick got their minimum trigger range reduced so that they can be used closer.
- Also changed some move preferences. Combo, left cut, and heavy swing are used more often. Combos are nice looking and effective. Left cut and heavy swing are good CC. And they represent downward swing, left swing, and right swing respectively. Katanas prefers using their combos making them good against single target. Heavies prefers their heavy swings so they work great in group fight.
- Increased all attack animation speed by 10% Faster Attack!
- Increased all defense animation speed by 20% Stronger Defense!
- Increased all stumble animation speed by 30% Faster Recovery! Allowing more chance to turn the table!
- Heavy weapons using light weapons move recieved small damage penalty.
- Light weapon using heavier moves recieved small damage boost. 
- Weapon using martial art moves took damage penalty but recieved high speed boost. They have poor AOE, got to compensate with speed.
- Increased max simultaneous hits for every moves, katanas and those smaller weapons should do better in group fight.
- Do note that there are lots of incorrect/weird weapon placement because the mod use animations unintended for those weapons. (Like using heavy moves with katana or vice versa. Or using martial arts with weapons.) I did not make the animations, all animations are from base game.

Current move list arranged by max trigger range:
Heavy Downcut - Charge forward and swing the weapon down hard. Longest range and thus the most common opening move.
Flying Knee - A mid-long range flying knee attack.
Jump Kick - jump forward and kick.enemy in medium-long range.
Combo - Press forward with 2 swing combo.
Mega Kick - spinning double kicks that looks cool but miss a lot.
Heavy Swing - Full body golf swing from lower left all over to the back right. Sweeping somthing like 270 degree around the user. Mad area attack which left user with huge opening.
Downcut - a simple single downward swing.
Left cut - pull back the weapon to the waist and make a very short quick cut with the waist.
Left palm strike - Take a large left step forward and strike with the left palm.
Low Kick - a quick low kick with the left leg.
Double punches/strikes - very close range one-two combo.

There are so many changes in attack animations that this mod probably affect the game balance. If you feel some moves are imbalanced, too weak or too strong, or if there is any change you would like, please leave comments below.

Thanks Woullak and his original mod "Flying sword" for the original idea of modding the combat animations. His mod enable martial arts moves for weapons. You can try his mod here: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1360386619

PS.Pardon me for the screenshot quality. I'm playing on a potato
author: BLKCandy

description:
Is plundering ancient ruins getting too boring for you? Do you want more danger in your character's lives? Is being eaten alive by fog men not spicy enough for you? Regardless of your answer to any of those questions, this mod is for you.

The Butcher spider is a quadrupedal robotic unit that earns its name from its unique ability to convert biomass back into useable fuel for its engine. Your characters? They're a whole lot of biomass. 

The Butcher spider will be guarding particularly valuable treasures at a few laboratories and will also be actively roaming any areas where Iron Spiders may spawn. 

Perhaps you may find a broken one somewhere that you will be able to re-activate for your own purposes...

The goal here was to add a unique and fearsome looking robot that will add an additional challenge to late-game ruin exploration. 

You can find the recruitable one in a factory, to the East... It's a challenging encounter, but you earn a valuable ally so it's pretty worth it in the end. 

Also, word of warning: Don't let the bot out of its cage before you recruit it. Otherwise, he'll get out of his cage and piss off on his own and there goes your murder bot.

Special thanks to Bear from the Kenshi Community Discord server for helping me test the brief questline. 

Link: https://discord.gg/NUGeJXp

Thanks very much for your time, I am open to suggestions regarding balance or creature design.
author: Seth_Knight

description:
Fixes pathing issues by setting the water avoidance of all humanoid and pet races to one value.

In the vanilla game, some races will navigate through water differently than others, which causes annoying issues such as...

- One character swimming and slowing down the rest of their squad
- Squads splitting up and taking different paths (dry and wet)

This mod makes all the races take the same path if they start at the same point.

Works for all the races that are recruitable in the Recruitable Prisoners mod too.

Have you recruited all the folks in the bar? Getting tired of checking every bars just for a measly recruit? Don't you wish you can just pay an NPC somewhere to find the recruits and bring them to your base? Well now you can!

Adventurers Guild introduces a new faction named Adventurers Guild (duh) that will bring recruits straight to your base. You can very easily find their representatives in the bar of almost all major cities, or go to their outpost close to The Hub or their main headquarters in Sinkuun.

===== HOW DOES IT WORK? =====

Well I'm glad you asked. When you talk to the representative in any Bar you will be given the option to ask for recruits. You can pick the race of the recruits, and then pay a headhunting fee to them. Few hours after the transaction a squad of adventurers along with your recruits will journey from the guild's outpost or HQ, whichever's the closest. Once they arrive you simply talk to the recruits and hire them individually. All done!

As a sidenote, this mod also introduces a new outpost named Ishijuku in the south, close to The Hub, and a new small city named Shirokyo in Sinkuun. You can find a bar in both and a robotic store in Shirokyo. These will be the place where the delivery squad spawns.

===== THINGS YOU SHOULD KNOW =====

This being a mod, there are a few limitations that you should be aware of to prevent your money being wasted for nothing.

- IMPORT IS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Some people that tested the mod claimed it works just fine without importing, but others reported that the NPCs don't appear if they don't import. Because of this I highly recommend to import your game straight away for a smooth experience.

- Do not ask for multiple same race recruits more than once before the delivery has arrived.
Doing this will overwrite your first delivery, aka wasting your money and time. This is game limitation, so not much can be done about that. Multiple race deliveries are fine tho.

- Ensure that your base is "active".
Someone must stay in your base for the delivery to execute. If no base is loaded the squad will not spawn and give another go after few days have passed. and YES, FEW DAYS. The re-attempt cooldown is automatically determined, so I can't modify it. You've been warned.

- Please build your base somewhere survivable.
Places like fog islands, deadlands, and black desert are no go zones for Adventurers guild. They will still take your money of course, but they will outright refuse walking in there for obvious reason (they don't want to die). So in case your base is there, I recommend building a small hut somewhere out of those regions to receive the recruits.

===== CREDITS =====
Big thanks to CATman4L, Shidan, Inflectus, and many more for giving me ideas, guiding me through the nightmare that is FCS, and testing out the mods. Wouldn't have survived without them.

description:
[img]https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/838084790287443064/A465F9B7821C8386C92CD83AAB7E615E305AD7E0/[/img]

Want a laid back place to discuss all things Kenshi? Looking to learn how to make mods for Kenshi?
Come join the biggest and best Kenshi discord on the net! https://discord.gg/Eap7TQu

[h1]Armor bugging out?[/h1]
Sadly I do not know what is possibly causing this... however simply saving/loading your game will fix it.
I suspect it has something to do with the mipmaps, but I've made this mod the same way I have made all of my other mods and I have never had this issue. Whenever I finally figure it out I will for sure fix it. I have been at it for over a month. x.x

[h1]What does it do?[/h1]
This mod adds the ability to craft armor out of "Hiver chitin" which is dropped upon death of a Hiver.

There are 15 pieces of armor.

Hiver Collector Cuirass, Hiver Collector Hat, Hiver Collector Robes, Hiver Cuirass, Hiver Cuirass Left, Hiver Cuirass Right, Hiver Cuirass No Shoulders, Hiver Greaves, Hiver Greaves Left, Hiver Greaves Right, Hiver Prince Mask, Hiver Sandals, Hiver Skirt, Wrapped Hiver Cuirass, Wrapped Hiver Prince Mask

[h1]Where to get it?[/h1]
You start with the ability to research the crafting table and armor sets. It requires nothing only the time spent doing the research. The Chitin can also be purchased at the armor shop in Mongrel, armor vendors in the Holy Nation and Hive traders.

[h1]Other Hiver variants?[/h1]
There were other variants, but they were causing a lot of issues. If I ever figure it out I will add them back!

[h1]Questions comments?[/h1]
Let me know if you run into any Hivers not dropping the chitin upon death.

author: Howls@theMoon

description:
Hello Drifters!

I decided to introduce the quiver to improve a little the archer role in these lands and why not, add a little variety to our play style.
The Quiver can be equipped in your backpack slot and allows you to store the necessary amount of arrows/bolts to go on a hunt or adventure without running out so fast of bolts.

Find below the Quiver details. 

[h1]Quiver Stats[/h1]
[list][*][b]Athletics:[/b] +10% (to allow archers more mobility and counterbalance the fact that carrying arrows increase encumbrance which lower running speed).
[*][b]Stealth/Dodge:[/b] -10% (all those arrows clunking around give you away).
[*][b]Combat speed:[/b] +10% (you can reach your arrows faster now that you have them at hand).
[*][b]Storage size:[/b] 2x5 storage. You can stack up to 9 of the same bolt in the quiver.[/list]


[h1]CRAFT / RESEARCH[/h1]

Research included in "Crossbow Bolts" research. Once you learn that, you will unlock the quiver.
The Quiver can be crafted in the Arrow Making Bench.

[h1] Location [/h1]

The Quiver may respawn in many vendors that have for sale crossbows, including The Hub's bar. I won't go on detail, find it in your adventure!

-*-*-*-*-*
EDIT: As per community request and considering balance, Quiver storage stack limit has been increased from 6 stacks to 9 stacks.

- Dig for Grubs (ceramic or wooden bowl)
- Research Box/Table (SURVIVAL tech tree added)
- Outdoor Workbench (craft Rat Trap and wooden bowl, camp kit, healing powder, splint kit, ammo.......)
- Outdoor Wood/Hides Crafting (craft dark wooden Sandals and Wooden Backpack)
- Outdoor Weapon Crafting (craft wooden staff, club, spiked club)
- Outdoor Raw Meat Barrel (store Raw Meat Items)
- Outdoor Food Barrel (store Food Items)
- Outdoor Animal Skin Crafting (make leather, craft clothes, sandals....)
- Outdoor Animal Skin Storage (store animal skin)
- Outdoor Animal Skin Storage (store animal skull)
- Outdoor Wood/Bone Crafting (craft bull skull helmet, sandals...)
- Outdoor Rice Straw Crafting (craft rice straw things like sandals and hats)
- Rice Straw Bale Storage (store rice straw)
- Outdoor Crossbow Crafting (craft a wooden crossbow and Tanegashima)
- Ammobox for wooden bolts
- Ammobox for Tanegashima gun ammo
- Rain Collector Barrel (collects rain)
- Craftable Rat Trap (to catch Rats)
- Craftable Crab Trap (to catch Crabs)
- Craftable Fishing Rod (to catch Thinfish)
- Craftable Fishing Net active and passive (to catch Grand Fish)
- Fish Drying Rack (Thinfish and Grand Fish)
- Craftable Mortar and Petle for fast herbal remedy crafting.
- Outdoor General Storage (storage everything)
- Map Marker (store things and get a mark on the map to find places easier again) 
- Seven vanilla tents to build with camp kit (great for nomads)
- Forge to make carcoal out of wood logs
- Charcoal genereator (dirty power rescource)


There are 6 types of trees you can chop wood. You should now be able to harvest wood in a lot of places around the world of Kenshi

Moonshine Fungus, Yuca Plant, Broc Flower, Xander Root, Quinoa, Sand Patatoes, Shiwanko, Wild Rice grow by themself, so you have to wait sometimes to harvest them.

Moonshine Fungus can be found in Forests and blue shining biomes, they are easier to spot at night :)
Moonshine Fungus is a halucinogenic narcotic. Its illegal in most towns.
You can make Moonshiner out of it with Cactus Rum. Also illegal in most towns. 

Yuca Plant can be found in Okrans Pride and around the Swamps.
You can fry or boil it to make food out of it.

Broc Flower can be found everywhere.
You can make herbal tea or healing powder out of it.

Xander Root can be found in everywhere. It is hard to spot them.
You can make splint kit or healing powder with it.

Quinoa you can find in a lot of places in the world.
You can boil it with water, so you can eat it.

Sand Patatoes can be found in sandy biomes.
You can eat it when you have roasted them on a campfire.

Shiwanko fruits can be found in the Vain, its a stinky slimy fruit which only is edible by Hivers. It grows only in biomes with acid rain. 

Wild rice can be found in the swamps, you can use it like normal riceweed. In this mod you can make rice straw and craft some straw hats and sandals with it.

Papaver Somniferum plant (poppy) can be found in the SE parts of the map or at your local dealer. You can use the raw opium to sell as narcotic or craft a better healing powder.

Added carbon rescource to the Floodlands
You can sell carbon or use this mod to craft some good weapons. Didnt test it but it should work.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1287335385

Added saltpeter and sulfur resource for blackpowder crafting. You can find it in the SE part of the map or in the Floodlands.

New craftable clothes/weapons are:
- Rag Shirt (hides), Rag Loincloth (hides), Martal Artist Bindings (brown), Wooden Sandals, Straw Hat, Clan Kamakura Armory (retextured or vanilla)
- FlipFlops, Plated Sandals, Leather Sandals, Eyepatch and Bull skull Helmet are made by oi_io
- Kenpogi (orange), Straw Sandals, Deep/Flat Straw hat, Roningasa, Hooded Cape, War Flag are made by OMOCHI 
- Bone Plank, Wooden Spear, Jaw Axe and Bone Claws are made by Arkhiel
-Tanegashima Gun and Hayagou (ammo) are made by DashK

You can find animal skulls around nests or kill some wild/domesticated bulls, Bonedogs, Beak Thing and so on. So you can craft the Bull Skull Helmet and the Plated Sandals.
You can find now animal poo and raptor eggs in nests.

All vanilla starts are updated to work with the mod. Added Blueprint for 100 cats at Adventurer Shops for non vanilla starts.

Please report bugs, so I can get rid of them.

I wont work on my Kenshi mods anymore. I dont have the time for it. Sorry
author: Stupendous Man

description:
You would think that co-operation with the locals would improve your relationship right? Well now it does!

This mod adds a small relations increase to Shek, TradersGuild, UnitedCities and HolyNation visits that involve the player having a base in their territory.
 
TG and UC tax visits will increase relations by 2 everytime you pay them.
Added Stone Rats extortion payment +2 relations
For Holy Nation when you successfully complete a prayer day it will increase relations with them by 5.

Letting the Shek eat your food stocks on tribute visits will increase relations by 2. If your challenged by random shek to battle accepting the battle will give you 1 increased relations, make sure to heal them if you win if your after good relations too.

description:
You want to purge the heretics, burn the rich or just have fun? Or everything vice versa? Then do it!

With this mod you can build a pyre/burning pole to torture your enemies with fire or to burn them to death alive.

You can find the pyre/burning pole in the section EXTERIOR. The construction costs two building materials and does NOT build an outpost.

*update v.2*

-Sound update

Attention:

As long as the fire is burning, the prisoner or his body can be taken down from the Burining Pole.

Once the fire goes out, the corpse can not be removed from the Burning Pole. Either you leave the pole with corpse as an ornament or you have to dismantle it. 

After that, the corpse float in the air. When you save the game and reload, the corpse lies on the ground and you can pick it up.

Unfortunately, I can not change this situation. Thank you!
author: Headhunter

description:
This weapon's mesh exists in the game's files, but isn't in the game for whatever reason. It didn't even have an entry in the FCS. I really like the look of it, so I decided to change that.

This mod adds the Flat Topper back into the game, a heavier katana that doesn't suffer from the same armour penetration issues that other katanas do because of its shape. I've tried to keep it as balanced as possible, while still giving it its own niche.

It should be sold at a variety of stores, and a meitou variant exists on a strong NPC around the border zone/swamp area.This NPC also has his own set of named/coloured armour. 

Thanks a lot.
author: Seth_Knight

description:
Did you know that Kenshi gets quieter as time goes on? That is because so many dialogues are only ever spoken once!

Now everyone can waste time speaking about the same things over and over again like real life! The Dried Gristle Flaps. The singing. And various other.

I pretty much just set bunch of dialogue from 'only once' to repeatable every week or so. Bar dialogues also trigger more often.

Tips for having a lively squad:
1. Travel! Many dialogues are triggered by entering new biome, especially strange and unique biomes.
2. Visit bars! That's where people talks.
3. Do stuff! By that I meant do big stuff like hunting legends and carrying them around.

And obviously, unique recruits have unique lines. Following unique recruits are some which I found unique lines in the FCS.

Uniques with many dialogues:
- Agnu the broken soldier bot. Beep's best friend
- Bard the wandering bard? Occasionally sings, or fails to sing.
- Beep BEEP IS THE STRONGEST WARRIOR! found in Mongrel
- Bo the famous anti slaver ninja. Has a special dialogue with anti slaver and has own dialogue package.
- Crumblejon the old man. He was a famous samurai working for UC.
- Digna the Flotsam Ninja who killed her own father to get away from HN.
- Doctor Chung the swamp surgeon. Has lots of dialogues with healing. Doesn't provide surgery service though.
- Ells the rum thief. I've found her quite endearing.
- Espher depressed hiver prisoner of Tengu's Vault.
- Griffin the ex-sentinel. Add some light of Okran to your squad. Some people really hate sentinels though.
- Hamut has vendetta against slavers but was rejected by anti-slaver for being more angry at slavery than anti-slaver...
- Headshot the Shek marksmen. Thinks he is somekind of a badass.
- Hobbs has some tall tales.
- Luquin the legendary noble hunter. Has a few dialogues in UC.
- Miu, ex-slave who escaped to the swamp with Ned. Has some interaction with Hamut. (I ship them) Hate spiders with passion.
- Pia, runner with dead Flotsam Ninja sister.
- Sadneil, even more depressed than your average skeleton.

Uniques with dialogues:
- Burn has just one unique dialogue on entering Deadland. Otherwise Burn jusr use standard skeleton dialogue. Just being skeleton already have a lot of 'interesting' dialogues though.
- Green has just one unique dialogue about thanking for getting out of swamp. Otherwise all his dialogues can be spoken by others. 
- Horse has some unique dialoges for entering some biome.
- Lumi the crab lady has special dialogue when seeing crab and on entering Fish Island.
- Ray, the mute soldier drone. Has exactly two unique dialoge. One is *nod* after defeating enemies. Another is ! when seeing animal eating farm crops... Well... he's mute.
- Reva, Flotsam Ninja who distrust men. Her only exclusive unique line is when she argue with Griffin on the comment on UC. Other special lines of her can be spoken by Digna.
- Ruka, the unhorned warrior. Has a couple unique interjection in Shek dialogue. Also has an interaction with Headshot.
- Shryke, the tech hunter, has a few dialogue for entering some places. Only a few though.

No dialogue uniques:
- Cat the dust king's prisoner has SUNDEMON dialogue package which is rare, but doesn't have unique lines.
- Chad, only standard package.
- Kang, only standard package.
- Infinite Wingwang... That's right, despite having high stats and one of the most unique recruit dialogue... he has 0 dialogue after that. He doesn't even have normal dialogue package!
- Izumi. While she has a few special dialogue references. Not a single line was exclusively hers. Most 'unique' line of her is shared with Pia...
- Jewel has only one special dialogue reference which can be spoken by other uniques.
- Knife has Flotsam Ninja dialogue package which is rare. Though she has no exclusive line. Digna can speak all of her lines.
- Oron, only standard package.
- Rane the Giant, only standard package.
- Riddly, has only one special dialogue that can be spoken by many other uniques.
- Seto, surprisingly, the daugther of Esata has no special dialogue. Though there are a few special dialogue for when you kidnap her.
- Silvershade, only standard package.
- Sinklyde, has only a few lines when first escaping the vault ten that's it. He use regular THUG dialogue package.
- Soman, only standard package.
- Stubs Monmuso, only standard package plus a few dialogues on swamp which can be spoken by other swamp recruits.
- Yamdu, only standard package.

If you found any weird dialogue or any suggestion, put it in the comment below!.
author: BLKCandy

description:
Expands The Holy Nation in many different small, but vital, aspects to give them more depth and detail. Nothing is OP or lore-breaking, just enhances certain aspects of the HN as a whole, such as adding in [i]holy crossbowmen[/i], introducing more [i]regal/ostentatious Holy Phoenix armor[/i], or [i]taming more animals[/i] at the HN farm animal trader.

Adjusted troop levels in HN patrols and armies to embolden their "power in numbers" approach. 



[IMG]https://i.imgur.com/fVVaDCS.gif[/IMG]



Adds in much needed [b][i]Holy Crossbowmen[/i][/b] for the HN patrols and armies to level the battlefield, where even measly bandits wield a bow. 

Along with that, light and medium versions of the Holy Chest Plate were added in to give the HN variety and immersion in their armor spawns.

2 animal races added to the Holy Farm Animal traders:
*[i]Domesticated River Raptors[/i](in 3 color variations)
*[i]Domesticated Cage Beasts[/i](in 3 color variations)

Small tweaks to the HN armor to allow for colorization based on faction and level within said faction.

Added in HN "[i]squatters[/i]' to abandoned Holy Farms.

Beefed up HN presence somewhat in Bast to lead to an even more chaotic and dynamic biome.




Credit goes to @HatsuneNeko for allowing for the use of her animal bags as a complement to this mod.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1528043574

His mod Unique Phoenix Armor is linked here:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1439207767
Credit goes to @Arkhiel for allowing for the use of his Ark weapon pack mod as a complement to this mod. 
His mod AWP - Ark Weapon pack is linked here:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=836295255
Credit goes to @rohan for his mod Light Holy Breastplate, linked here:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1335922236
Credit goes to oi__io for his created mesh for the medium Holy Chest Plate.

description:
A mod augmenting the Shek Kingdom by fleshing out the spawns in certain towns and cities, along with the addition of more bar squads and roaming squads in various biomes. 
Added in shek [i]squatters[/i] squads to many abandoned Shek Kingdom buildings. 

In addition, a new shek sub-race was created called the [i]Kezok[/i].



[IMG]https://i.imgur.com/fVVaDCS.gif[/IMG]




A mod that expands upon the Shek Kingdom and somewhat lengthens their reach and heightens their organization. 

Bar squads were added to various Shek Kingdom towns and cities. 

Roaming squads were added to most Shek Kingdom cities.

Shek Kingdom biome squads were added and were made somewhat more varied. 

Shek [i]squatters[/i] were added to many abandoned Shek buildings that had little to no use prior to setting squatter squads to utilize the space. 

A new Shek sub-race, the [i]Kezok[/i], was added and spread throughout every Shek Kingdom spawn and even into some other faction spawns, where Shek race spawns were present.

Additionally, all shek armor and clothing was altered to use their preferred faction color, when possible.

author: TreadLightly77

description:
Mod to rebalance economy to make in-town shopkeeping more viable and more interesting. Everyone wants to run a comfy inn, right? Now you can do it without every single peasant in town going broke from buying a single rice bowl and not regenerating money, because it's really a buzzkill for a horde of people to flood your tavern and scream about how they can't afford things. Yes, Universal Basic Income has come to the world of Kenshi. On top of that, shopping lists have been expanded in general, more NPCs will go shopping, and there's more of a dynamic to NPC income and spending. 

A few NPCs that lacked them now have shopping lists. Income levels will roughly correspond to class - your average tech hunter will have more spending money and income than your average peasant. 

[b]WEAPONS AND ARMOR HAVE BEEN ADDED TO SHOPPING LISTS![/b]
[i]Yes, you will need to import your game for this to work if you've been using the mod all along.[/i]
Not many NPCs will be prone to buying them, and fewer still will be able to afford your best blades, but they're out there. 

A few notes about the quirks of shopping:
-People actually buy items by class. If someone wants narcotics, they're just as open to hashish as they are to grog as they are to sake. 
-The most desired items, by far, are food and alcohol.
-Adventurous types will buy first-aid supplies and sometimes weapons and armor.
-Nobility, if they deign to leave their houses, may stop by your shop for luxury items, trade goods, and random clutter. So will caravans. 
-Skeletons drink alcohol too. Don't ask. It was already set up that way. 
-Most cities don't have public wells. I HIGHLY URGE YOU TO DOWNLOAD THE [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1321702013]"MOISTURE FARMING" MOD BY TRINIMAC[/url] IF YOU WANT TO SET UP SHOP IN A CITY. 
-More people should stop by to shop, both in towns and at your outpost.
-If you have a mod that adds additional NPCs, they will be just as poor as the mod maker made them. If you see odd behavior, check your modlist.

This also includes a rather cheaty barkeeper start for testing purposes. It gives you basic farming tech, hydroponics, and brewing tech, as well as enough money to buy a small building and set up shop. 

Many thanks to love-tea for showing me how to do the impossible and get NPCs to buy armor and weapons. It was the one feature I really wanted, and now it's here. There will be rebalance releases as I tweak things, please let me know in the comments if anything seems off or like it needs improvement. 

JP translation as follows:

Google翻訳で日本語に翻訳されています。翻訳が貧弱であれば、お詫び申し上げます。

[h1]メジャーアップデートが削除されました、下記を参照[/h1]

経済を再調整して、町の店での買い物をより実行可能でより面白くするためのMod。誰もが快適な宿を経営したいのですね。町の農民一人一人が丼を買うのではなく、お金を再生するのをやめてしまうことなく、今やあなたはそれを行うことができます。はい、普遍的な基本所得はKenshiの世界にやって来ました。それに加えて、一般的に買い物リストは拡張され、より多くのNPCが買い物に行くでしょう、そしてNPCの収入と支出にもっとダイナミックなものがあります。

それらを欠いていたいくつかのNPCは今買い物リストを持っています。所得水準はおおよそクラスに対応します - あなたの平均的な技術ハンターはあなたの平均的な農民よりも多くの支出と収入を持ちます。

[b]武器と防具は買い物リストに追加されました！[/b]
[i]はい、modをずっと使っているのであれば、これを機能させるにはゲームをインポートする必要があります。[/i]
多くのNPCがそれらを購入する傾向があるというわけではありません、そしてあなたの最高のブレードを買う余裕がまだあるだろうが、彼らはそこにいます。

買い物の癖についてのいくつかのメモ：
 - 実際には、クラスごとに商品を購入する。誰かが麻薬を欲しがっているならば、彼らは彼らが目的のためにそうするのと同じように彼らが弄ることと同じくらいハッシュにオープンです。
 - 最も望ましいアイテムは、これまでのところ、食べ物とアルコールです。
 - 冒険好きなタイプは応急処置用品を購入し、時々武器と防具を購入します。
 - あなたが彼らの家を出ることを決めた場合、貴族は、高級品、貿易品、そしてランダムな雑然とのためにあなたの店に立ち寄るかもしれません。キャラバンもそうでしょう。
 - スケルトンもアルコールを飲みます。聞かないでください。それはすでにそのように設定されていました。
 - ほとんどの都市には公営井戸がありません。私はあなたが街にお店をセットアップしたい場合は、トリニマック社による「湿気農業」MODをダウンロードすることを強くお勧めします。
 - 町やあなたの前哨の両方で、より多くの人々が買い物に立ち寄るべきです。
 - 追加のNPCを追加するMODがある場合、それらはMODメーカーが作ったのと同じくらい貧弱になります。あなたが奇妙な振る舞いをしたならば、あなたのmodlistをチェックしてください。

これはまたテスト目的のためのやや厄介なバーキーパー開始を含みます。それはあなたに基本的な農業技術、水耕栽培、そして醸造技術を提供します、そしてまた小さな建物を購入して店を建てるのに十分なお金を与えます。

不可能を実行してNPCに防具と武器を購入させる方法を教えてくれたLove-teaに感謝します。それは私が本当に欲しかった一つの特徴でした、そして今それはここにあります。私が物事を微調整するときにリバランスリリースがあるでしょう、何かがオフであるように思えるか、それが改善を必要とするようなものであれば私にコメントで知らせてください。モッドは、私が満足しているポイントに近づいていて、大部分は安定していて、まともにバランスが取れています。重大な問題がある場合は、コメントを削除して何が壊れているか教えてください。
author: Travbro

description:
Mine and refine oil to make fuel.

[h1]Unlocks 3 buildings:[/h1]
      Manual Oil Drill:
          - Requires someone to drill the oil
      Oil Drill:
          - More expensive but is an automatic source of oil
      Oil Refinery:
          - Refines oil into fuel for use in a generator

Oil is meant to be a mid-game energy source for settling in places with low wind or for roleplay. It uses the water ground resource, similar to a well. The research costs 1 Book and 1 Ancient Science Book.

OK, I will accept my defeat. Before some update, carbon was a thing you could find in the ground via the prospect menu, just like copper or iron. My plan was to allow the player to mine oil based on the carbon levels in the ground, so I spent a good few hours making it all work. Once I was almost done, I set the mining resource to carbon for the oil drills, and realized that carbon was removed from the map. So now I have made it require water instead. Sorry for the rant...

If you want me to add a new feature, rebalance something, or fix an issue, just leave a comment and I will try to reply to you ASAP.

Kenshi Community Discord:
Link: https://discord.gg/82W5z2W
author: The Emerald Popcorn

Enjoy!!

author: Hex

description:
Gives all default defensive gates 10x more HP repair at 2x the speed.

This allows your gates to survive attacks from fogmen or cannibals for 1-2 minutes before they fall without being maintained.

With a team of high level engineers behind it, the 2x repair speed could allow you to delay the gate falling for a very long time while you have reinforcements mount turrets or travel from afar.

If you annoy a main faction however, they will still be able to break down your gates quite fast, but with enough delay to give you decent warning to flee or prepare for the fight.


(Instructions to make your own mod are in this link should anyone want to make a version with functionally invulnerable gates with 1 billion hp) https://steamcommunity.com/app/233860/discussions/0/1694918539666939389/

description:
By default, your stats can reach 100 max.
With this mod, they can reach 250 max.

NB :
- they still start at 1, this mod only modifies the Max value.
- to avoid strange game behavior, smithing skills and athletics are still capped at 100.

Caution : it's impossible to level up organically past level 100, even with this mod active (the limitation isn't only on the max stats, but also on the stats' formulas).
You'll need to install my other mod "Cheat Training Dummies" to do so :
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1628313635
Use it only to go past level 101, then you'll be free to continue your legit playthrough.
(Note : I advise you to skip directly to level 104, as the levels 100 to 103 are weirdly long)


Important note : 
The XP Formula in Kenshi is a Bell Curve, in which level 100 is the center:
- it gets increasinly difficult to gain level, up to level 100.
- it's impossible to level up to 101 without an external program.
- levels 102 and 103 are very long
- from level 104 and up, we go down the Bell Curve and the levels become faster and faster.
- so you'll go faster from level 400 to 500, that it'll take you to go from level 200 to 400.

Bags are 5X bigger.


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

description:
Enemies squads' numbers is much more random now.
The overall game balance is still the same.

Example :
- Vanilla : a Dust Bandit Squad is composed of 9 or 10 members (so 9.5 members on average).
- Modded : a Dust Bandit Squad is composed of 1 to 19 members (so 10 members on average, like in vanilla).

Why this change?
When you start the game, you simply can't attack most squads, as they'll overpower you and your very little team.
Now, if you're lucky, you could find 1 Dust Bandit alone, waiting to be killed, and give you that sweet sweet XP.
And, if you're unlucky, you could also find 19 Dust Bandits thirsty for your blood and ready to rumble; giving you a perfect opportunity to train your athletics. ;)

So, do you feel lucky today?


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

[h1][i]Fieldstripping a crossbow and reassembling it repeatedly, until we can do it blindfolded, will allow us to improve handling of the weapon, including reload speed, target acquisition, and ultimately, accuracy.

Allows to comfortably train crossbow skills to around level 10 and up to level 20, if you have a decade.[/i][/h1]

-----------------------------------

This mod adds a new furniture building piece called "Crossbow Training Station" in "Training" building category. 

The visual of the building consist of crossbow and few bolts resting on a small table.

Characters can use this to train Crossbows skill in a reasonable time to level 10 and given enough time to maximum level 20. Description reflects that.

A research item to unlock this building has been also added under the same name, requiring tech level 1, and "Better Training Dummies" as prerequisite. Cost of the research is 2 books and 2 hours. 

All assets are from within the game, Crossbow and bolts slightly modified to be usable as building parts.

[h1] Does not require an import. [/h1]

Does not touch anything not added with this mod, so there is no potential for conflict with other mods.

Does not upgrade. 

Trains Crossbows skill only, perception and friendly fire might still be an issue.
Do target practice for that.

[h1] Known bugs and workarounds. [/h1]
[list]
[*] Sometimes on the very first try, right after installing the mod and after doing the required research, if you try building this furniture piece, the placeholder will have wrong shape and will not allow to place the building. Until we figure out what causes the issue please do the following workaround: 
Rightlick to cancel the build and select "Crossbow Training Station" again, it will work this time. 
[/list]

[h1]Please rate / comment / subscribe if you like it.[/h1]

[h1]All feedback is welcome.[/h1]

Greetings and salutations to the Kenshi community Discord #modding crew at https://discordapp.com/invite/yCxTxGd
author: sEver

description:
Tired of having your city raided multiple times a day?
This mod makes raids 10X less likely to occur.

Vendors buy your items 3X cheaper, money is harder to get.

Getting money in Kenshi is very easy.
I get it so fast, I don't even have to look at my money balance, when recruiting or buying items.

This mod divides by 3 the price of items, bought by vendors.
Example :
- Vanilla : you sell 1 item for 100 cats.
- Modded : you sell 1 item for 33 cats.

NB :
- this only affects stolen, non-trade items, armours and weapons : there's no sell multiplier for other goods (their multiplier affects both buying and selling, which defeats this mod's purpose).
- the price you have to pay to a merchant, in order to get an item, isn't changed.


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

All Bolt ammo packs have 5X more charges.

Tired of micro managing your 255 crossbow users, checking every fight if they still have ammo?
Worry no more, with this mod, every bolt pack contains 5X more ammo, so they'll deplete 5X slower.

To balance this, their prices, componants, production time and weight have also been raised.


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

First Aid Kits have 5X more charges.

Tired of micro managing your 256 characters, checking every fight if they still have First Aid Kits?
Worry no more, with this mod, every First Aid Kit and Skeleton Repair Kit contains 5X more charges, so they'll deplete 5X slower.

To balance this, their prices, componants, production time and weight have also been raised.


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

Training Strength by carrying Weight is 10X faster.

Let's face it : you only over encumber your chars, when you train their Strength; then run around like headless chickens, waiting for their strength to level up.
(Or when you steal a whole shop's inventory, to sell it to the nearest city...you sneaky sneaky thief)

This mod makes this process 10X faster.

Tip : carry someone, to double this bonus (like in Vanilla).

Adds weak Enemies squads (1 to 3 members) roaming around, ready for your team to train their fighting skills.

Leveling the fighting skills in the early game is very difficult, as you will only encounter large squads of tough opponents.
This leads you to avoiding almost all fights, and only attack when opposing factions' squads are already killing each other.
Not anymore :)

This mod adds many squads of 1 to 3 enemies, ready to give you some sweet combat XP.


Notes :

- they have (50% the original ones' probability of spawning; for example a vanilla "Wolf Swarm" has 4% chance of being spawned in Bonefields. 
Its weak version, with 1 to 3 enemies, has 2% chance to spawn.

- there is a limited number of spawn points in all regions, which can potentially spawn enemy squads.
I tested this by adding hundreds of enemies in the spawn list of a region, with a spawn rate of 100%, they didn't all appear on the map : only one squad can spawn in a spawn point.

- when a spawn point is activated, the game will look into the spawn list and roll a dice, but will always spawn something.
For example, let's say a region has 5% chance to spawn bandits and 5% chance to spawn wolves.
One spawn point can then either spawn a bandit or spawn a wolf, with a 5% probability for each.
I thought that a spawn point could then remain empty, if no bandit or wolf was spawned, but no, the game will instead spawn an animal (for example a spider in the great desert).

- Most areas have a very low squad spawn chance (less than 5% spawn chance), so the game will most of the time spawn an animal instead.
In these areas, this mod doesn't lower the difficulty, as it'll have a chance to spawn a weak enemy squad instead of a neutral animal one (though some areas have hostile animals).

In conclusion, I think this mod doesn't lower the difficulty in areas where the spawn chances are low (which is the case for most areas).
It does (slightly) lower the difficulty in areas where the spawn chances are high (so a few areas in the whole game).

In order to impact less these high spawn chances areas, I edited this mod so that the weak squads have 50% chance to spawn, compared to their vanilla counterparts.
(From the original 200% I originally set)


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

Beds heal you 25% faster.

Tired of waiting, each time your squad is wounded?
This mod will slightly quicken the bed healing process.

Modified values : "ouput rate".
- Bed : from 8 to 10.
- Camp bed : from 4 to 5.
- Skeleton repair bed : from 8 to 10.

Note : for a faster healing version, you can use my other mod.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1604256426

[Simple map replacement with Topographic look, Grid, Zones, Zone names and Roads]

This map variation suppose to represent [u]height levels of terrain[/u]. It includes [u]grid[/u], [u]zone outlines[/u], [u]zone names[/u] and [u]roads[/u].

There are more variations of [b]Nice Map[/b] that might fit your taste.
Check these out at [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1607561817][THIS COLLECTION][/url]

Hope you like it. Feedback is welcome. Have a [b][i]nice[/i][/b] time playing [b]Kenshi[/b]! рџ‘Њ

* * *
Known issue - water colour doesn't match GUI map background. I've noticed that too late and was too tired to remake all of these versions. It takes much time just to manipulate texture file itself because of it's size, not mentioning all the screenshots and such stuff. Maybe someday I'll fix it.
* * *
[i]Relevant for Kenshi v1.0.9
I'm using [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1200632417]Dark UI[/url], you may have noticed it on screenshots.
Materials used: original Kenshi map (GUI_Map.dds) located in game's folder; Map with zone names from [url=http://kenshi.wikia.com/wiki/World_of_Kenshi]wikia page[/url] used as reference; Various textures located at "Kenshi\data\newland\land\", such as heightmap (fullmap.tif) and roadmap (new_overlay.png).
Managing all these versions is pretty frustrating process, so... don't expect much updates.

Also, if you want to edit any of Nice Maps - feel free to do so. Would be [b]nice[/b] if you'll mention me in description after that.[/i]

description:
Martial Artists don't use the very long "matrix dodge" animation anymore, only the step back one.

This animation takes almost 1 full second to be executed, so it's not uncommon to have your character stuck in a dodge-dance, when fighting multiple opponents.
It's particularly true when you fight very fast attacking opponents, with a modded "max attack slots" at 5, and do a solo run : your character will almost never attack, just matrix dodge dance.

By disabling this animation, your character will only use the "step back" animation, thus gaining precious time when fighting.

Note : this mod doesn't affect any other Martial Arts animation (so he won't attack faster).

This mod works very well with "Martial Arts Fast Dodger", if you want your character to execute dodge animations faster.


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512
filePath: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\workshop\content\233860\1615749836\Martial Arts No Matrix Dodge.mod

description:
Martial Artists dodge animations are 40% faster, so he won't dodge dance during the whole fight.

The dodge move animations, compared to a blade block, take forever to be executed.
This mod makes your character dodge faster, so he'll be able to attack in large fights.
It's particularly true when you fight very fast attacking opponents, with a modded "max attack slots" at 5, and do a solo run : your character will almost never attack, just dodge dance.
This mod corrects that.


Notes :
- this doesn't improve your dodge chances, only the time required to execute the animation
- attack animations are unchanged

This mod works very well with "Martial Arts No Matrix Dodge", if you only want your character to dodge by stepping back, instead of matrix dodging.


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

*Required import*
In vanilla setting, NPCs who are shopping buy foods, alcohols and first aid kits. 
They never buy weapons, armors, books and so on.
This mod adds drifting NPC who can buy many items.
Their races are random, and sometimes have a hiring dialogue.
Also, most of all don't have money and wages, so I also set them.
But, someday, NPCs who live in towns will lose their money and never get wages because of systems.
To have money, I mean some people, especially who are rich, HAVE money.
You can get them, so I want you to enjoy hunting riches.
Also, rich characters visit your town and can buy expensive goods.



＊インポートが必要です＊
バニラの設定上、買い物をするNPCは食料、嗜好品、治療キットくらいしか買いません。
武器や防具、本などは設定されていません。
このmodは色々な品物を買う放浪NPCを追加します。
放浪NPCの種族はバニラのものからランダムで出現し、雇用可能な者も居ます。
また、バニラでは所持金や収入の設定がないので、これも追加します。
しかし、賃金システムが機能していないため、いつの日か町民の所持金は尽きます。
なお、お金を持つという事は、特に高貴な方々を中心に、実際にお金を『所持』するという事です。
奪う事もできるので、金持ち狩りを楽しんでください。
また、拠点に金持ち集団が訪れる様になり、高い買い物をしてくれるかもしれません。

description:
Fighting weak enemies Always gives XP, contrary to vanilla. 

In Vanilla, a high level character has a 90% XP malus, when fighting an enemy with 25 levels less than him.
With this mod, the same 90% malus only applies, when facing an enemy 1000 levels below you.

Enjoy killing bandits, they're worth it again. :)


Note : if you want a "50 levels below you" version, use my other mod :
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1616003450


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

This mod aims to remove the cheese wealth mechanics that make Kenshi too easy, and make your struggling, suffering and overall challenge in Kenshi greater. If you like it leave a thumbs up.  

Best played with Shidan's [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1116463641&searchtext=longer+contracts]Longer Merc Contracts[/url] mod, Bayrock's [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1681216962&searchtext=ironman]Ironman Mod[/url], and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1509740976]Dangerous Hazards[/url]. [i]For mod load order do longer contracts->ESC->DH->ironman, for it to all work correctly.[/i]

[h1]Econ and Base Changes:[/h1] 
Easy cash cheese mechanics nerfed hardcore. Shops are much more discerning now and won’t pay top dollar for used tainted gear that was obviously just looted from a corpse. You will risk starving for a good portion of the game and will cherish hard earned cash much more.
[list]
[*]Prices you can sell items for has been drastically reduced. Looted armor and weapon, and player made gear, now sell for 1/4 of the amount you could sell for in vanilla game. 
[*]Prices of all other items that are not trade goods now sell for a mere 1/8 of their full value, food, ores, intermediary goods (iron plates etc). 
[*]Rare ruin items like power cores and skeletal eyes are 1/2 their value now and are also used for base building. 
[*]Trade goods (rum, grog, sake, hashish) sell for about 2/3 to 3/4 their value in vanilla but are now very hard to mass produce due to more labor intensive farming and water changes.
[*]Prices for illegal trade goods reduced significantly across the board.
[*]Medical supplies and luxury goods are now basically non-player made trade goods and still sell for full price so are valuable to find. Cheapo items like cups still sell for full price.
[*]Places where hashish and hemp were legal, but not lawless, have now had their price reduced ever further (such as Catun, Clownsteady, Flat’s Lagoon, Mourn, etc) and you won't make much profit selling at those places.
[*]Shop counters have been disabled.
[*]All crops now take twice as long to harvest. You may now need to allocate multiple farmers to harvest things before they die.
[*]Tanning, making armor plates and making chainmail now use laboring skill instead of armorcrafting.
[*]Animal skins now produce only half a leather instead when you tan them.  
[*]All construction times now double.
[*]All dwelling structures and walls take twice as much building materials to make. 
[*]Store bought building materials now doubled in cost.
[*]Doubled all research costs (books, schematics, ai cores, etc) which now slows base development a lot and really forces you out into the world and ruins. 
[*]Increased the research time multiplier for higher level technologies. 
[/list]

[h1]Combat and Creatures:[/h1]
Vanilla was too easy with an army of chars, you now need to make the best of a much smaller team and have many of them multitask.
[list]
[*]Faction limit now capped at 12 chars.  If you need more than that you will need to spend cats and get mercs.
[*]To make animals more useful in such a small squad the stats of ownable animals have been buffed 15 to 20%, garrus buffed slightly less since they are still best mobile storage. WARNING: This also means similar wild animals types (bonedogs, goats, bulls, garrus, etc) may be tougher.
[*]Attack slots increased to 2 (you can now have 2 people attack the same target at once, and they can do the same to you) so getting swarmed and KO'd by a large mob of weak enemies is a real risk now.
[*]Swamp turtle stats doubled and they have been given a high damage attack type. No longer are they the easy PZ walking meat generators of the swamp. BE WARNED!
[*]Meat drops on all animals reduced significantly from 1/4 to 1/2 their original. Teeth and leather drops also reduced and sell for much less than their old value. Beakthing egg value reduced significantly.
[*]The amount of drop items from uber bosses left unchanged and value of unique drops left unchanged.
[*]All blunt weapon weight reduced by about 25% and given +30% additional armor penetration.
[*]All chaimail armors have had a slight increase to blunt protection since they were a bit weak before.
[/list]

[h1]Water is life now:[/h1] 
Water should be one of the most scarce and valuable resources in Kenshi, I've tried some changes to reflect that.
[list]
[*]Water table rates halved in most all biomes, reduced even further in some. Swamp is now the only place to have 100.
[*]All wells (even electric ones) now require an operator, making it much more labor intensive, especially in low water areas. To compensate for this, basic non-powered wells no longer count as towns and wont get raided so it is possible to have well outposts (that have nothing but wells) in high water areas and import water in.
[*]All well output reduced, but scaled.  Manual well output reduced by the most, about 50%, while well III reduced the least, about 20%.
[*]All farm field water usage now scales with size, in vanilla they were all the same. A medium field now uses the default amount of water in vanilla. Small fields use half that, large and XL now scale up with XL using about twice what a medium field uses for water.
[/list]

[h1]Differing resources per sector:[/h1]
Biome resources now scale with difficulty. Easier biomes to live in like borderlands now have reduced everything. Iron and Copper reduced significantly in most areas especially easier ones. Specialized biomes like swamp now have the most water but way less minerals and stone. Polluted biomes with no water and food have significantly increased minerals. Harder biomes with difficult creatures and raiders have the best overall resource stats.  See link [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/1619600173/1628539187772120098/]here[/url] for detailed listing of changes.

[h1]Ruins Progression for Base Building[/h1]
Some key base buildings are now locked behind needing ruins gear in order to build them to encourage ruins exploration and make end-game bases more progression based.
[list]
[*]Wind Turbines, fuel generators, and most fully automated heavy machinery now take Advanced Circuitry to build.  The means to fabricate Advanced Circuitry has been lost to time and can only be found in ruins.
[*]Batteries, Skeleton Beds and Robotics Bench now require Power Cores to build.  The technology to make Power Cores has been lost to time and can only be found in ruins. 
[*]Harpoons Guns now takes Ancient Long Bore Segments to build. These are pieces of precisely constructed durable alloy barrels which can no longer be manufactured.   Ancient Long Bore Segments can only be found in ruins. 
[*]Stone and Iron processors and some other heavy machinery now take Gears to build.  Gears of such quality and durability for industrial use can not be produced anymore and must be traded for or scavenged from old Empire ruins.  
[*]Heavy Armor Smith now take multiple Grind Machine Pieces to build.  Modern smiths never really re-learned the old ways of their pre-industrial ancestors and instead mainly craft their wares using semi-mechanical methods with scavenged metal cutting gear found in ruins. Weapon Smiths II and III take tools to build.
[*]Research Bench 4 now takes a skeleton eye to build in order to properly analyze the cryptic ancient research books and engineering schematics. Skeleton eyes can only be found in ruins.
Research Bench 5 and 6 take even more Skeleton Eyes to build.
[/list]

[h1]Personal Statement:[/h1]
I made this mod mainly for myself. I love survival games that make you struggle, suffer and feel like you just "never have enough". I find it fun being forced to make hard trade offs and tough decisions. This mod isn't for everyone but if you enjoy it, have suggestions, or find errors in it please let me know.

description:
Weapon wielding enemies aren't skilled Martial Artists anymore.
In multiple boss enhancing mods, cutting someone's arm often leads to him becoming a better fighter : switching from his weapon to his deadly arms and feet.
Not anymore.

Training Weapon skills takes time, the same goes for Martial Arts (and even more time in Kenshi).
So assuming each NPC trained both skills to the same level, just because they can use a sword, doesn't seem logical to me.


Enemies carrying weapons have had their Martial Arts skill divided by 3.
This way, they won't switch from doing 70 weapon damage with their limbs intact, to 150 fist / foot damage when they get an arm cut off.

Example : a High Paladin's "unarmed stats" went from 95 to 32.
(His weapon skills remain untouched)

Finally enjoy cutting people's limbs, without them turning into Bruce Lee's doppelgangers.

Notes :
- If you want a version, which only divides Martial Arts by 2, use my other mod :
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1620398738
- If you want a version, which only divides Martial Arts by 5, use my other mod :
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1625785496


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

Martial Artists' attacking moves depend on the distance, between you and your enemy.
In Vanilla, there are ranges where your character has No attack assigned, so he'll just wait there or slowly move towards an attacking enemy.

Not anymore.

Jump Knee (obtained at 55 Martial Arts) and Jump Kick (30) have been modified to fill those gaps.

Here are the vanilla distances :
- From 0 to 2, your character uses KickLow (learnt at Martial Arts level 5).
- From 0 to 3, Double strike (25).
- From 0 to 3, Double punch high (25).
- From 0 to 3, Double punch mid (35).
- From 0 to 7, Shotei L (15).
- From 5 to 7, Mega kick (45).
- From 7 to 9, No Attack Move is available.
- From 9 to 10, Jumpkick(30).
- From 10 to 13, Jump knee (55).

Here are the modded ones :
- From 7  to 10, Jumpkick(30).
- From 7  to 13, Jump knee (55).

Enjoy punching and kicking your foes, whatever the distance is between you and them.


Note : this mod affects both your Team and your Enemies.


If you want to check my other mods, click here :
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1605538512

"Don't go to the floodlands, people who go in there don't come out!"

"No one goes into the deadlands and comes back alive."

The people of Kenshi are in general agreement that the areas of the world populated by the Old Machines are very dangerous and should be avoided. Unfortunately, by default these areas are mostly barren and what few wandering enemies you discover tend to be rather harmless or slow. A character with a pair of sandals and a few points in athletics can easily make the trip to the scrapyard in order to access the most powerful gear available right from the start. The most dangerous part of the visit is the weather... 

This mod aims to make these areas more dangerous. Iron Spiders have been given a larger detection radius and will also often be accompanied by smaller lighter Scout Spiders. These aren't quite as deadly and are significantly less durable than regular Iron Spiders. However, they are very fast and quite capable of chasing down runners. Stopping to engage them will give their slower cousins more of a chance to catch up, making them have the potential to actually be dangerous. Areas such as the floodlands and the deadlands can generate the large roaming packs of security spiders that you find in other locations. These will also now include contingents of scout spiders, as can the guard groups found inside of ruins.

The rare hostile high skill broken skeletons that you could sometimes run into are more common and can also include sniper varieties with high powered crossbows. Rarer groups of these rogue machines can also spawn together instead of solo.

Old Machines are now friendly to Skeletons and will coexist better.

For best experience, combine this mod with Seth Knight's Scarier Security Spiders mod.

description:
[b]This MOD makes NPC a slave to a player character.[/b]


[h1]What this mod does [/h1]
[b]This mod essentially gives you the ability to have your own slaves as the NPC factions do. [/b]


[h1]How it works: [/h1]
[b]Make "Slave Rings" -> capture enemy -> stick in cage -> put slave ring on him -> prompt will come up asking to "sell" slave (you don't actually sell them) -> select the slave and "sell" -> you now have a slave you can talk to and issue an array of different instructions (including "Join my Squad")

If the above doesn't work first time, take the ring back and take the slave out of the cage and attack them till they go down. Then first aid them, put them back in the cage and give them the ring back. This should trigger it.

For slaves bought from slave shop you need to have the ring with you when you buy them, you should get the "sell slave" prompt shortly after. If not, use the above method.[/b]

[b]Spcial Thanks: Sir Spliffington VIII[/b]


[h1]What can be done for various NPCs [/h1]
Not a slave NPC: to slave
Slave shop slave NPC, and slave captured slave NPC: purchased as a player slave
Slave NPC: Submission
Submissive slave NPC: order (following, bodyguard, labor etc.)



[h1]Additional research [/h1]
*Shackles Craft ... Slave Ring Craft Bench and Shackles Craft Bench
You will be able to build it.
*Slavery ... Buildings for slave will be built.



[h1]Additional buildings [/h1]
Slave Ring Craft Bench ... You can create slave rings.
Shackles Craft Bench ... You can create Prisoner Shackles.
[b] * [/b]Building with mark ... It is a building for slave labor.



[h1]Items added [/h1]
Slave Ring ... It is necessary to capture, purchase, and create slave squads of slaves.



[h1]Added Faction [/h1]
Added "slave" faction. It is a neutral relationship to all the faction.
The characters that I belong to are sold at slave shops and I am wandering through the field.
* It is a different thing from the existing "slaves" faction.



[h1]Other changes [/h1]
Cats obtained when selling abducted people in slavery are random at 
800, 900, 1000, 1100, 1200, 1300, 1400, 1500.
(It was 400c in vanilla)



Because of the number of characters, details are indicated on separate threads.


This MOD is compatible as it uses data of "Players AI" of another MOD.
It can also be used at the same time.

Common elements of Players Slavery and Players AI
Capture of slaves, purchase, submission, order etc.

Features only for Players Slavery
Building of slave building
Addition of "slave" faction
The selling price of the slave will be changed to random drawing of 
800, 900, 1000, 1100, 1200, 1300, 1400, 1500.

Features only for [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1573720404]Players AI[/url]
Add AI squad
Addition of Cannibal's building

* If you try to load Players AI after Players Slavery
The slave's selling price will return to 400.
Players AI
Players Slavery
When used in the above order it will be 800-1500.

... what is it?
This mod adds a bunch of new/missing crafting animations to the game.
It does neither override any existing animations nor does it need an import to run! :-)

... what is included so far?
- 11 new animations + several special tools

... supported races?
- all races (Humans, Hivers, Skeletons, Shek) both male and female.
- all (modded) playable races like Cannibals, Fishman, ...

... supported crafting stations?
- Heavy Armour Smithy
- Arrow Making Bench
- Engineering Bench (still uses arrows)
- Clothing Bench
- Cooking Stove
- Copper Alloy Bench
- Crossbow Crafting Bench
- Plate Beating Station
- Research Bench I-VI
- Weapon Smith I-III
- Leather Tanning Bench
- Leather Armor Crafting Bench
- Robotic Limb Bench
- Stone, Ore and Steel Processors
- Chainmail Sheet Fabrication Bench
- Hybrid Stone Mine I
- Chain Armour Crafting Bench
- Robotics Bench
- Biofuel Distillery (Wheatstraw, Greenfruit and Hemp)
- Rum and Sake Still

... (major) known problems/limitations?
- it's not possible to use two "special tools" at once - so one hand is always empty
- animation speed depends on the skill level
- minor clipping issues with female/very thin bodies and long arms
- some clunky parts in the animations
- mod does not work with "custom races", because there is no link to the animation files - I'am on it!

... keep in mind
this mod does not override any existing animations/skeleton files, but it replaces the reference to the "generic use" animation. it also uses some existing materials.


Stay tuned for updates

description:
In Vanilla, Skeletons and Robot Limbs suffer damage over time.
This reduces their max health, until you find a skeleton repair bed.
I got tired of running back and forth such beds, and removed this constant constraint.

Note : you'll still need to repair their damages, when an enemy attacks them.

[h1][b] FOR BEST RESULTS, IMPORT YOUR SAVE. [/b][/h1

[h1][b] NEW: [/b][/h1] Holy Farms should no longer have floating fences. If you find an NPC farm that has floating or strangely placed fences, let me know! [b]Will require save import for changes to take affect on prior saves.[/b]

Patch for General Modifications mod: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1639109313

Patch for the Farming Crops Enhanced mod: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1632086996

This is an update to the crop field's fences to something that doesn't look totally useless. Each tier of fence has the same dementions so you can easilly organize your farms.

The fences are purely visual and won't actually protect your crops or impede movement. Characters will simply walk through them.

For best results, raise the fences up when placing them with the +/= key.

Known Issues:

- Farm plots that are part of the world (i.e. Holy Farms) tend to have floating/intersecting fences. Don't know how that could be fixed outside of editing each plot individualy.

The fences are purely visual and won't actually protect your crops or impede movement. Characters will simply walk through them.

For best results, raise the fences up when placing them with the +/= key.
