description:
[h1] I will add a Escort Mission to deliver the merchants and the wanderers traveling in various places to the town. [/h1]


[h1] NPC that can provide a Escort Mission[/h1]
Traders Guild Caravan
Hiver Merchant caravan
Slaver caravan
Merchant Nomads
Mercenary wanderers
Drifter solo
Drifter solo (skeleton)
Bounty hunter
Wandering Assassin
Black dog (New 2019/3/5)
[b] ※ You must be out of town to undertake the guard duty. [/b]


[h1] How to Escort Mission [/h1]
1, Talk to the character traveling in various places and take over the guard duties.
2, We will guard until the object arrives in town.
3, When the escort object arrives in the town, the fee will be paid.
Relationship with the faction to which the escort subject belongs will improve just a little.

[b] * The mission success judgment is done when the escort object enters the town.
The fee will not be paid if you are away from the object at the time of judgment.
* The duty period is one week. Even if it expires it can be redeemed on the spot if outside the town.
* If you want to cancel your mission, please move away from subject.
* The mission success judgment is done also outside the play screen.
(Example) Even if you keep track of the guard object and guard the task for the task and secure it outside the screen
If you arrive safely in town you will be successful and you will be charged a fee.
* The amount of compensation varies depending on the Tech level of the player and elapsed time after the conversation with the target.
It does not change in the state of escort target.
* As a known problem, in a transaction (conversation) of a merchant or a mercenary to be escorted
The elapsed time of the escort is initialized.
Transactions before arriving in town may result in loss of fee amount and loss of compensation fee. [/b]


[h1]Other changes[/h1]
I added a bodyguard conversation to a Drifter solo and a Drifter solo (skeleton).



[h1]3/5/2019 Update: NPC that can do bodyguard mission[/h1]
United Cities patrol squad
The Holy Nation patrol squad
Shek Kingdom patrol squad
Flotsam Ninjas patrol squad
Holy Nation Outlaws patrol squad
Bounty Hunters patrol squad
Drifters (solo) patrol

[h1]How to Bodyguard Mission[/h1]
[b]The procedure is almost the same as the guard mission, but the bodyguard is not a delivery to the town, it is a task to protect the target until the contracted time.
* You will receive compensation from the client after the contract time.
* If the client fails to faint or talk, it will fail if the contract time is passed.
* When you arrive in town, the request will be interrupted, the compensation will change according to the elapsed time of the mission.
* Specifications and known problems are the same as guarding mission.[/b]

description:
[b]This mod replace textures with compressed ones.[/b]

Compressed textures: [list][*]for landscape from 2048 to 1024
[*]for some other stuff from 4096 to 2048.[/list]

Those changes will help to reduce loading time, will reduce stuttering and save some VRAM, so overall performance will get a massive performance boost.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


[b]В данном моде выборочно пережаты текстуры ланшдафта и обьектов, чтобы сохранить компромисс между качеством картинки и влиянием на производительность.[/b]

Не секрет, что игра использует свыше 10Гб текстур, преимущественно размера 4096x4096px. Регулярный стриминг ресурсов подобного размера сильно замедляет общую работу приложения, особенно при подгрузке игровых регионов на системах без SSD, с видеокартами у которых не более 4Гб видеопамяти.

Основные правила пережатия текстур были такие: [list][*]2048 > 1024
[*]4096 > 2048
[*]Выборочные 2к и 4к текстуры не были затронуты, т.к. их пережатие значительно снижало качество текстур в самой игре.[/list]

Пережатые текстуры дадут небольшую прибавку к частоте кадров и значительно сократят время подгрузок текстур с диска в память.

author: Schmidt

description:
This subtly skews the economies of the different factions to open up the 'Trader' style of gameplay. It now becomes much more worth your while organizing trade routes between factions and regions, importing exporting goods. A faction will generally want what they can't produce in their own biomes, and sell cheaply things that they can.

This mod works by adding a few more 0.5x to 2.0x standard price modifiers on goods in different areas (adding to what was already there in vanilla). The modifier is first applied to the base price of the commodity before the 'town' price for the good is randomly calculated on the result (vanilla: +/- x50% - x150%), meaning there is still fluctuation between towns keeping each new game (or each import) fresh.


Compatability:
This should be fully compatible with most shopkeeper and economic rebalance mods (like Neko's) as this does not touch base prices, only the 'Trade Culture' special modifiers for certain goods. Any mod that just changes what shopkeepers have, or the base cost of items, will still work with this.

See "Discussions" for a guide, full list of changes, requesting compatibility patches, and reporting bugs/giving feedback.


To-Do:
Maybe set up repositories/warehouses in certain, heavily distanced cities, to make it possible to bulk buy an entire Garru's worth of goods if you're willing to haul them, such as a rum distillery in Bark, or a luxury hive artisan in Dreg.

author: Ashlander001

description:
This mod is a ressource for modders, and I hope it will help people to get into 3d modeling. 
I need your feedback so we might adjust the used zones.

So, what is a part map ?
In FCS, when you create an armor, you can set part map zones.
9 colors are available, 3 are used by default.

So what does this mod do ? 
Vanilla part maps only hide armpits, torso and belly for humans. Hivers actually haven't theirs, and skeleton only have one colour used (only for some parts of the torso. )
The mod makes use of the 6 remaining colors, so you can actually hide the whole body ! If devs add more colours, I'll separate some zones. For example pelvis and legs, or legs in 2 parts (which would help for vanilla pants that clip). 
It also adds hivers (queen excepted) a real part map for them, as they used human's while having absolutely not the same texture pattern.
That means that all hiver races but queen have a new path (so  beware for compatibility issues, even if kenshi is well made for handling it). 

Why ? 
Because it extends modding possibility. Want to make a helmet that replaces the body with another one? You can.
Wanna make high heels for the waifu ? You can.
Wanna make very close to body armors without worrying too much with clipping ? You can.

How can i use it for my mod ?
Just check at the pictures to get an idea of which zones are covered by which color. In FCS you'll have to check these colors is you need to hide a part.
For example, orange will hide hands ! 

Complete zones list: 
White zone (vanilla) : armpits ; https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670240465
Red zone (vanilla) : torso/boobs : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670238483
Green zone (vanilla) belly (front only) : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670239531

New zones (could change, because i'd like it to be a community thing, for modder convenience without altering vanilla ones). 
Blue : rest of the torso and back, that are not covered by vanilla
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670240302
Magenta : Arms without hands : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670239337
Cyan: feet, at the moment stops at ankle, could cover vanilla boot zones 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670239811
yellow : neck (might add any zone barely used, as the zones should mask everything)
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670238084
orange : hands : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670239131
purple : legs + pelvis https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1670238954

Unfortunately, head cannot be hidden, that would be even more fabulous for modding possibility, but maybe it'll change ;) .
author: Arkhiel

description:
This simple mod makes it possible to free all slaves. In the original, the slaves could have been "capricious" and did not want to leave their cages, they could not be all are led by you. Now they will be "capricious" with only 70% probability. So if you persist, they will follow you or try to escape alone from such persistence. Speaking of single escapes, their chances are also changed, so if singles will be caught, the next time when they are released, they can follow you. Thus there is a chance to lead all slaves to freedom and the possibility of their recruitment.

import required

FREEDOM FOR ALL SLAVES!

Этот простой мод позволяет освободить всех рабов. В оригинале рабы могли быть «капризными» и могли не хотеть покидать свои родные клетки. Теперь они будут «капризными» только с вероятностью 70%. Поэтому, если вы будете настойчивы, они последуют за вами или попытаются уйти в одиночку от такой настойчивости. Говоря об одиночных побегах, их шансы также изменились, поэтому, если одиночки будут пойманы, в следующий раз когда они будут освобождены, они могут последовать за вами. Таким образом, есть шанс привести всех рабов к свободе и возможности их вербовки.

требуется перенос

СВОБОДУ ВСЕМ РАБАМ!

description:
REQUIRES COMMUNITY PART MAP (because that's why I made it anyway ;) ) 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1671502407

If "The higher the heels, the better I feel" suits you (or your in game waifu), then this mod is for you. 

Of course, kenshi is a harsh world, so heels will have a penalty on athletics, and a small bonus in MA damage because a heel in the face hurts. 

It might clip with pants but I'll probably make an overlap mesh later, and actual dresses/skirts or shorts that wont collide with it. 

BP and heels are sold in every good armour trader, except in HN because.. duh you know why. Crafted on leather bench. Oh and they work surprisingly well on men too! (didn't need a specific mesh). 

Enjoy and notice me if anything doesn't work :).
author: Arkhiel

description:
For those who like the vanilla game but haven´t a chance to trade with some shops again for the next hundret years. Because they never ever trade with you after they saw you stealing their stuff. 
This mod allows you to trade with every trader in the game again. 
You can only trade with them for some extra cats and only once in two ingame days. (Hard thief life)
author: Flightcaptain

description:
[h1] Fixing Clipping Issues [/h1]


[h1] What this mod does: [/h1]

The mod attempts to remove/reduce clipping in game in two ways:

1)By introducing slimmed down meshes for pants, skirts and some headgear that the game uses when you put a cloak on in combination with them. The mod does the same for boots.

2)By fixing meshes that clip even when not used in combination with other equipment

[h1] Equipment that alternative meshes were made for: [/h1]

[b] Pants: [/b]
Drifter’s leather pants, cargopants, halfpants, all the pants that use monk mesh, wornout shorts, rag loincloth, armoured rag skirt, hack stopper pants, crab trousers, plated drifter’s leather pants, stout hessian, and female samurai leggplates.

[b] Boots: [/b]
Drifter’s leather boots, plated longboots, and all samurai boots.

[b] Headgear: [/b]
Armoured hood, Bucket Zukin, Karuta Zukin and Turban.

[b] The game already has slimmed down meshes for samurai clothpants and samurai leggplates. [/b]

[h1] Normal game meshes that have been fixed: [/h1]

[b] Pants: [/b]
Drifter’s leather pants, cargopants, halfpants, hack stopper pants, crab trousers and plated drifter’s leather pants.

[b] Coats: [/b]
All coats


[h1] Known issues: [/h1]

I couldn't remove all the clipping issues so there will be some, especially when you are moving, but it is still much better than what it was.


[h1] Compatibility: [/h1]

This should not conflict with other mods, but the meshes will not be applied to armors from mods that introduce new armors with old meshes like “Colored Clothes Redux”. A patch will have to be made. A patch will also have to be made for mods that have new coats.

[h1] Patches: [/h1]

Patch between this and [h1] Coloured Clothes Redux: [/h1], made by Mr Wibble.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1679302353
Patch between this and [h1] Dread Gear: [/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1680046799
[h1] Mediocre Black Armor: [/h1] has the patch merged with it. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1294713819

[h1] Links [/h1]

Nexus: https://www.nexusmods.com/kenshi/mods/290

[h1] License/Permissions: [/h1]

Do not reupload this mod without permission.

If anyone wants to make a patch between this and other mods or you are a mod creator who wants to use meshes from this mod as slimmed down versions for new armors (in Kenshi) you are free to do so.

If somebody wants to translate this mod into other languages and post it, you have permission to do it, just mention the original mod somewhere in the description:)

[h1] Credits: [/h1]

Game developer for a great game.
author: Timor1234

description:
[b]The largest collection of buildings and furniture from older versions of Kenshi and non-player towns. Over 415 new buildings and furniture pieces to construct, plus another 295 copies of buildings, walls and furniture using alternative textures.[/b]
_________________________________________________________________________

[h1]Forgotten Buildings Includes:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Tier 5 walls, concrete walls, and other walls from the old world
[*] Moor buildings
[*] Swamp buildings, platforms and fences
[*] Hive huts, cannibal shacks and metal buildings
[*] Outposts s-I, s-II and s-V
[*] Old storm houses and broken watchtowers
[*] Lagoon buildings and platforms
[*] Ancient labs, citadels, factories and domes
[*] Old HQ buildings and bunkers
[*] Five types of bridges
[*] All signs and banners
[*] Oil drills, silos and refineries
[*] Water towers, water tanks and windmills
[*] Alternative farms, mines, grain silos and wind generators
[*] Auto-turrets and multi-barrel turrets with lights
[*] More lights and tents
[*] Market stalls and quarry equipment
[*] Tarsand pipes and other structures
[*] Ruined versions of many buildings and walls
[*] Any furniture missing from vanilla research[/list]

[b]Similar items are grouped in the build menu, use the arrow buttons to switch between them.[/b]

A complete list of everything you will be able to build is available [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/1679230269/1752394282892250923/]here[/url].

A list of all research and blueprints can be found [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/1679230269/1678063648150917548/]here[/url].
_________________________________________________________________________

[h1]Other Features:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Slopeless-like building placement, without the risk of buildings moving
[*] Defensive Wall V has its original appearance restored
[*] Moor buildings are available in all four of the original textures 
[*] Stairs added to Double House, Moor C, Moor Tower, Saloon and Tallhouse 
[*] Raised House roof is accessible
[*] Turret and/or light nodes have been added to many buildings, walls, towers and gates
[*] Furniture can be built on swamp platforms and lookout towers
[*] Most furniture can be built outdoors (excludes crafting and research benches)
[*] Climbable defensive wall towers (stairs are hidden inside)
[*] New ramp attachment points
[*] The lights built-in to some Defensive Wall/Tower/Gate models can now be switched on
[*] Signs snap to light nodes for easier placement
[*] Functionality added to Fishing Rods, Drying Racks, Oil Drills and Oil Refineries
[*] More buildings and walls now have ruined forms
[*] The largest buildings are appropriately difficult to construct
[*] Many improvements to models, textures and collision
[*] Completion of unfinished buildings from the game files: twelve so far and more to come[/list]

Many things can only be learnt from blueprints, which can be bought or looted from locations where the buildings are found. If you really dislike this idea, or have already visited the location of a blueprint you wanted, there is the option to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1761052811]use the research bench instead[/url]. 

If you're having trouble finding a blueprint [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/1679230269/1640912849414623484/]this list[/url] should help. 
_________________________________________________________________________

[h1]Compatibility:[/h1]
[list]
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1740462542]Slopeless[/url] must be above Forgotten Buildings to allow buildings to be placed correctly. If you aren't using the duplicate gates from Slopeless, it can be disabled.
[*] Forgotten Buildings now contains everything included in [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=720660382]Interior (and Exterior) Design[/url], although anyone already using it can continue to do so. Forgotten buildings will work best if it is below the Interior Design mod.
[*] While there is a lot of overlap with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1395580587]more building[/url], the two mods are compatible. To avoid duplicate items in the build menu, you might want to try [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1646683744]Plant Trees[/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1617402087]more building(natural trees only)[/url] or [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1873962647]more building(Interior and Exterior only)[/url] instead of using the full mod. Forgotten Buildings should be below more building in your list.
[*] If you use [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1689573745]Work Bench Variations[/url], you might want to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1776678770]download this[/url].
[*] Any texture replacement mods such as [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1649794243]Compressed Textures Project[/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1676068316]Detailed Textures Pack[/url], [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/kenshi/mods/171]Enhanced_Textures[/url] or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/kenshi/mods/113]Texture Options[/url] must be above Forgotten Buildings in the mod list or many buildings will not appear correctly. Anyone who uses Compressed Textures Project or Texture Options can also download [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1933601230]smaller versions of the textures in this mod[/url].
[*] Forgotten Buildings is included in [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1980348818]Project Genesis: World Overhaul[/url]. This version of the mod should be disabled while using the overhaul. [/list]
_________________________________________________________________________

[h1]Translations:[/h1]
[list]
[*] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/kenshi/mods/546]Russian[/url][/list]

If you would like to create a translation, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1803659078]this template[/url] can be used as a starting point.
_________________________________________________________________________

[h1]Non-Steam Version:[/h1]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/kenshi/mods/301]Forgotten Buildings on NexusMods[/url]
author: Mechanica

description:
This Submod unifies all Hive Scenario Series + new starts and adapts them to the GenMod system.
The original gameplay mods are not needed as the starts have been completely redone.

Changes:
+ Removed Robot Status- All Hive Queens 
+ Workers have backpacks with materials and food
+ Soldiers have improved stats and a combat cleaver.
+ Princes are all-rounders with a Iron Stick
+ Starting Technologies : Farming Basics, Hive Architecture, Hive Queen Throne

--------
Scenarios / Starts:

Insane Queen : Start as a Fogmen Queen and their group.
Southern Queen : Start as a southern Hive Queen and their group.
Dark Queen Rises: Start as a dark Hive Queen and their group.
Hive Queen: Start as a Hive Queen and their group.
Hive Unity: Start as Dark, western and southern Hive Queens and a groups
West - South Hive Alliance: Start as Western & Southern Hive Queens and a group
Enslaved Hive Queen: Start as a enslaved Dark, southern or western Hive Queen.
--------
Other changes

Enslaved Rebirth Starts:
+ Dark Hives
+ Reddish Shek
+ Bluish Shek
+ Greenish Shek

GenMod Vests & Cloth Shirts -> Race Exclude
+ Dark Hive 

--------

You need the main mods
General Modifications : 
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1222324217

Advanced Character Creation - Basic:
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1651120230

Advanced Character Creation - Races:
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1664134440

--------

Robot stats are still visible on the screenshots. I removed them after taking these screenshots. The reason was that the Enslaved start is hardly playable otherwise.

author: Bayrock

description:
Apparently corpses lack any real food value to certain exotic animals that can be recruited using other mods.

This really simple mod sets all vanilla non-mechanical (that would be weird) animal types to have the "eat food on ground" AI behavior. 

"Ground" apparently includes food barrels and animal feeders.

Should work with almost anything.
author: Scorpomancer

description:
The rope will reduce athletics as much as possible resulting in your prisoners moving at a snails pace. 
Goes into the footwear slot, hiver rope goes into the pants slot.

Sold by slave traders and stolen clothing vendors.



Cred to @Michael24 for the idea.
author: blot

description:
This mod expands the 3 major hive factions in the game with unique armors, weapons, races and characters!

New REBALANCE PATCH: Hive revenge attacks when queen is kidnapped/killed now brought down to more acceptable levels, Reimport is recommended to make sure changes take effect.

Buy hiver notebooks to build your own paintable hiver armors. 

Hive praetorians now guard the queens of their respective hives. They are a formidable threat.

Kidnapping the queen of either hive will now cause them to send waves of ever increasing size against you with unique commanders. 

Killing the queens is now not without consequence as both factions will launch a final desperate revenge strike against you with what remains of their forces.

kidnapping or killing the southern hive queen will have extremely dire consequences for you

and much more content for you to discover!

Mod requires import


Incompatibilites:

Compatibility Issues may occur with mods that change what equipment and armor the hive factions/fogmen use or those that change the hives in general. If you wish to use it with new weapons dissemination mod please download this patch for NWDM https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1688805294 . So please keep that in mind when using this mod.
author: Circumsoldier

description:
Adds graphical variation to a number of commonly used workbenchs and alternative storage for crafted items. I designed this to differentiate at a glance between benches that one often builds several of due to how their product queues need different resources.

Currently incledes:
Platebeating, Copperalloy, Robotics, Small research, Electrical, Arrow Making and Cooking Stove, Looms, Iron storage, copper storage, cotton storage and stone storage, riceweed storage, hemp storage, wheatstraw storage, greenveg storage, cacti storageand raw meat storage.
In addition creates upgraded or new instances of beds, armour stand, armour storage, weapon stand, food store, barreltables2, small limb storage (skeleton), Electrical storage, crossbow parts storage,small steel bar storage, leather storage, skins storage, robotics storage, fabric storage, Boltbox, CopperAlloy storage, Armour Plate storage,Chainmail sheet storage, building material, iron plate and steel storages.

built and tested on 1.0.17-0.19 @1920x1080. In low priority slot. 

research hooks are placed for all new buildings, including a cheat research incase of mod conflict.

This mod includes my standalone mods; small limb storage, armour stand and weaponrack mods. These should be uninstalled as they are incompatible.

May conflict with any mod that alters vanilla research, furniture or core textures. This mod increases the number of mesh and textures loaded for props, not tested under stress conditions... ie lots of furniture or more than 30 characters.
Compatible with Compressed Textures Project mod (some transparent textures are black), AnimationOverhaul - crafting mod, Reactive world mod and Interior/Exterior design mod.

Thankyou to Blubb, for permission to use his eComponent assets from AnimationOverhaul - crafting mod.

Thankyou to Mechanica for making an improved compatability patch mod between this and his Forgotten Buildings Mod. Link - https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1776678770

Thankyou to Lo-fi for allowing modifications to their game and proving the tools.

Credit to oi_io for the idea that upgraded storages should keep same footprint and expand vertically with ingame stats to reflect this.

Original mesh and textures by Lo-fi Games, manipulated by myself in Blender using Import/Export plug-in by Lof-fi Games, and Paint .net.

Feedback welcomed.

Link for .zip [pending], for non Steam users.

Please ask if re-uploading elsewhere and provide link back to this forum. Thankyou.
author: SnugSnug

description:
Simple mod adding parchment production.
Though part of a larger set of mods i have made(making) which allow the construction of artifacts, and even trade goods. I understand people want to pick and choose what parts of the set they want, so it's all split up. I am aware there are like 400 other mods that do the same thing as this set.

based on fabric manufacture,

~ ~ Tech ~ ~ 

Parchment manufactue
    - allows cotton based mfg of parchment 
    (Tech level2 -  costs 3 books)

Hemp-based Parchment
    - allows hemp based mfg of parchment 
    (Tech level 3 -  costs 5 books)

AutoParchment Press(Cotton)
   - auto version of the cotton parchment press 
    (Tech 4 - 2 Ancient science books + 8 books)

AutoParchment Press (Hemp)
   - auto version of the hemp parchment press 
    (Tech 4 - 2 Ancient science books + 8 books)


~ ~ Buildings ~ ~

Parchment Press (Cotton)
same model as loom, uses labouring
(4 Iron plates, 1 Gear, 1 Press) 

Parchment Press (Hemp) 
same model as loom, uses labouring, 3x faster
(4 Iron plates, 1 Gear, 1 Press) 
is about 

Parchment Auto-Press (Cotton)
same model as loom
(8 Iron plates, 4 electrical components, 2 gears, 3 Press)

Parchment Auto-Press (Hemp) 
same model as loom, 3x faster
(8 Iron plates, 4 electrical components, 2 gears, 3 Press)

Parchment Storage
Same model as fabric storage, stores 100 parchment
(1 building material)


Notes:
I do not own kenshi or anything this mod uses, i dont care if you build it into your own mod, a credit would be nice, but i just hope you enjoy making your own mod and if mine help that's nice too :)
author: Ubermanlet

description:
Add ability to craft iron cuffs.

"Handcuffs and legcuffs. They stop you from running and doing a lot of things. They will trip you up in combat."

- goes into the belt slot
- prevents ability to fight and run

You can use the prisoner as a punching bag.

Can be crafted upon research of the "Imprisonment" technology.
Heavy armor smithy is required.
author: EgorMotor

description:
Decorate your houses with this collection of paintings. There are currently 160 images to choose from, each available in four sizes.

The majority of the pictures are official Kenshi artwork, and the remainder are screenshots that have been altered to look more like paintings.

Paintings will become available to build after completing the "Art Collecting" research at tech level 2. Construction requires Luxury Goods, which can be bought from hive traders or stolen from nobles.

author: A

description:
[h1]Hi, welcome to DialoguePlus+! [/h1]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/fVVaDCS.gif[/img]

This mod aims to add more variation in dialogue you encounter around the world of Kenshi, and tries to keep it all serious & lore friendly. You should hear more variation in bar chatter, in raids, attacks, et cetera!

It also aims to tweak and fix any typos or grammatical errors left behind by the development team, and expand on existing wordswaps functions to give more variation even in vanilla dialogue.

I've lost count of lines, but I believe it's around or above 1000 lines now added to the game.

Open to queries and suggestions, if you want a conversation I'm Chime#9999 on discord or you can just add me here on Steam. I am more active on Discord, however.

[h1]Areas currently expanded upon:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Bar Dialogue added to the Holy Nation bars. Around 250 lines, with plenty of variation and wordswaps!
[*] Generic Bar dialogue added to most non HN bars.
[*] A somewhat comedic variation on player characters screaming about Acid Water.
[*] More biome comments added to: Darkfinger, Deadlands
[*] Small addition to Flotsam Ninjas.
[*] Variations added to the "Attack" dialogue, specific to certain conditions your characters may have.
[*] More band of bones shouting.
[*] More local variation added to bars in the Hook.
[*] More bar chatter added to Mongrel.
[*] New slave intro.
[*] A little more variation on swamp ninjas.
[*] More wordswaps.
[*] More dialogue! [/list]

[h1]Compatibility:[/h1]
Should be fine with all other mods!

Prefer using NexusMods? [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/kenshi/mods/391]Find DialoguePlus on the Kenshi Nexus here![/url]

description:
[h1][b]Bookshelf:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Item Storage research[/h1]
The Bookshelf has enough storage space for all your books. It can also store things like notes and letters; anything made of paper should be able to go in here.

[h1][b]Bunk Bed:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Beds research[/h1]
You should build it with the longer sides away from the walls so you can access both beds. It's possible that characters will try to sleep in the same bed when they automatically go to sleep, and unfortunately there's nothing I can do to prevent that. Order characters to use the beds from opposite sides to make sure they sleep in the right place.

[h1][b]Chair:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Basic Furniture research[/h1]
Just a small wooden chair to sit on.

[h1][b]Electrical Wall Torch:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Indoor Lighting research[/h1]
Similar to the Electrical Torch Post, but this version attaches to walls.

[h1][b]Hanging Gas Lamps:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Indoor Lighting research[/h1]
The ordinary Gas Lamp doesn't attach to ceilings like other indoor lights, so it will always be at the same height, which doesn't look great in buildings with a high ceiling. I've added a new version that hangs from a support beam.

[h1][b]Large Table:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Basic Furniture research[/h1]
A table big enough for the whole squad to gather around. There are two versions, with and without the map seen in the images above.

[h1][b]Rusty Bathtub:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Random Furniture research[/h1]
There's an empty bath and a full bath. Each version can be upgraded to the other, although if you upgrade the use node won't work correctly until you load game.

[h1][b]Small Round Table:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Basic Furniture research[/h1]
It's a table that's small and round.

[h1][b]Solar Panels:[/b][/h1]
[h1]New Solar Power research[/h1]
They can be seen on top of the tier 5 gate, but appear nowhere else in the game. Now you can build them on the ground or on rooftops. Researchable after completion of Advanced Wind Generator Theory. I wasn't able to stop them generating power at night, but each panel only has a small power output.

[h1][b]Wall Bookshelves:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Item Storage research[/h1]
Wall shelves to store your books.

[h1][b]Wall Torch:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Default Start research[/h1]
A small burning torch to attach to your walls.

[h1][b]Toilet:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Random Furniture research[/h1]
A metal toilet that can be built indoors, for those who prefer not to use an outhouse.

[h1][b]Dog Bowl:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Item Storage research[/h1]
An alternative to the Animal Feeder, it can also be placed indoors, for the rare few buildings that allow animals inside.

[h1][b]Armour Display Stand:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Gear Storage research[/h1]
Enough inventory space for a full suit of armour. Can be decorated with items using my Clutter mod.

[h1][b]Coat Stand:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Gear Storage research[/h1]
Storage for clothing and armour.

[h1][b]Plant Pots:[/b][/h1]
[h1]Added to the Random Furniture research[/h1]
A choice of six plants in a wooden barrel pot.

[h1][b]Coloured Carpets, Sitting Pillows, Camp Beds, Chairs, Beds and Bunk Beds:[/b][/h1]
[h1]New Dyed Carpets/Dyed Pillows/Dyed Sleeping Bags/Dyed Upholstery/Dyed Bedding research[/h1]
Researchable once you have the original furniture. There are seven colours to choose from.

author: Snugsnug

description:
Legend of the Grievewraith
“	Holy Nation legend tells of the souls of the lost Shek becoming consumed by malice, hate and envy for the living. Their naturally 'aggressive' nature, as the Okranites claim, make them the most easily corruptable by the 'demoness'. The Grievewraith consists of a rotting corpse with the spikes, or limbs, of a flesh insect protruding from it's back, supposedly this is it's mid-transformation into a beast.

Now, legend aside, we've had numerous sightings of these wraithes both by Holy Nation residents and adventurers, mainly around the ruins of the central plains. So far we've learned that they are nocturnal and they prefer to take victims in the rubble of cities which have been heavily touched by death. All of it's victims have disappeared without trace, we can only assume fully consumed by the wraith. A likely explanation for their existence would be a parasitic form of flesh insect, one which roots itself into the boney matter of a Shek body, and continues to grow and control the body even after it's victim has perished and begun decomposition.

- Idad  "

Based upon the legend and a broken model I found in the game files.

You thought blood spiders were scary? Wraiths make them look like cute puppies in comparison... Both faster and waaaaay stronger... Even high level characters are likely to be eaten en masse. They're mostly nocturnal and sometimes spawn nests. Okran help you if you blindly walk into a nest...

If you see a wraith, best thing to do is run unless you got a hardened platoon armed with desert sabres. Though if you do manage to kill one, you can sell their horns for a large profit, even more so in the holy nation.

They mostly spawn in the holy nation territory... Mercifully they're rare so you wont see many if any at all.

Don't go near the ruins in Skinner's Roam unless you have a deathwish.

Other Legends:
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1877448247] Mist Ghouls [/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1882920758] Foulhounds [/url]

Patches
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1882919742] Tame Beastie
author: Daemonic Spoder

description:
This simple mod allows you to level buildings without development tools or having to carefully drag it. Buildings have a natural and realistic look and play very well. Doesn't take anything off from the vanilla gameflow, balance or difficulty. It's intended to be used on [b]uneven terrain[/b] but it works fine as much as inside hill walls. Should work well with just about any mod and savefile as it just change footprint placing permissions.

[b]Please, read carefully before asking questions. Enjoy it and have fun[/b]


[h1]What does it do:[/h1] 

Completely removes slope requirements for buildings so they can be placed in any terrain.
The terrain gets removed from inside of the buildings, so it can be placed as much as inside mountain walls.
Increase vertical position tolerance, so players can make their buildings as high as there's foundation underneath [url=https://imgur.com/OMrvsfr](Default ' - and = ')[/url]
All that can be done without the development tool, so you don't need to cheat and move the structure. Just place buildings like usual
Should work with your previous save (no need to New Game or Import) and just about any mod, even those that deal with buildings and new towns. Just make sure to set Slopeless at the bottom of the mod order list


[h1]Known issues:[/h1]

Buildings still follow slopes. You just 've got to hold your change slope hotkey [url=https://imgur.com/OMrvsfr](Default ' ] ')[/url] and it snaps perfectly
Buildings with balcony inside the terrain mess up. People can go upstairs and teleport above ground and that screws up pathfinding too. Just don't use buildings with balcony inside hills if you don't want that to happen
Hills cutting through balcony have no collision but they do appear. Doesn't screw people navigation and actually looks pretty cool, but ideally people would be able to climb that leftover piece of terrain instead of ignoring it
Doesn't help much with walls. It does allow you to place them anywhere but it still looks weird
[url=https://imgur.com/a/hNjBxPC]Removes building collision with other buildings[/url]. Overlapped buildings behaviour is such that both buildings keep it's collisions and textures, so the overlapped section have no pathfinding. This means that they work actually fine and that's just a aesthetic concern that players can avoid. Also a little bit of overlapping, specially as long it's unreachable parts colliding (foundations) actually makes sense and is completelly harmless
When trying to zoom and look from inside buildings inside cliffs the camera colides with the hill. Easily manageable but a little annoying

[h1][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/1740462542/3264459260614750315/]FOUND A ISSUE?[/URL]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/1740462542/3264459260603128302/]SUGGESTIONS AND REQUESTS[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/1740462542/3264459260603094720/]CHANGELOG[/url][/h1]

[b]This mod isn't deeply tested. Any oversight, suggestion and feedback is welcome.[/b]
author: Gyropilot2

description:
Adds 16 new lore-friendly animals all across Kenshi's world: Chimpanzees, Bloodhounds, Fiddler Crabs, Acid Wasps, Carrion Crawlers... 

I don't want to spoil the excitement of finding the new creatures for you, so the full content list is in the discussions section and marked as spoiler.

Two Screenshots as teasers: Fiddler Crab and Bloodhound. There's also a new game start where you start with a Bloodhound pup.

If you really want to see all creatures before installing the mod, screenshots of every new creature in their natural habitat can be found on my Steam profile page.

Also now there is a CHEAT start for testing purposes but I wouldn't recommend using it. Some of the new animal (concepts) are meant to surprise you and you'd spoil that for you. 

I'm by no means a professional 3D Artist. All I did was messing around with Blender and Gimp. Expect some minor flaws, like slightly distorted textures. Please tell me if I may have made any obvious errors that need fixing.

Please also report if you find any inconsistencies or balancing issues. Like animals spawning in unexpected places, being too strong or too weak, conflicts between animals and npcs that shouldn't / mustn't happen, etc.

Why TIHYD? 
=================================================================

This is a reference to my now second favourite game-of-all-times, Project Zomboid, whose savegame loading screen motto is "This is how you died". Try it out, it's great! I love rogue-like gameplay and plan to publish a series of mods which make Kenshi even more diverse, immersive, harder... and deadly! This prefix is intended to group them all together.
author: MECR

description:
There are 2 body types for skeletons and 5 options for heads, but only 8 skeleton races are actually inthe game. So I beheaded a MKI Skeleton and put it on a MKII Skeleton's body!

I also added in severed skeleton limbs to all skeletons, so when a skeleton loses a limb a limb actually falls to the ground and rolls away.

[b]-------------------------------------------------------[/b]

This mod adds:

* Two new races the Skeleton MKII and the Skeleton MKI No Head

* 8 models of severed skeleton limbs for all 10 races

Please note, removal of mods can damage a save file. Importing after removal can fix the issue, but the import button is not magic. Back up your save game file before installing a new mod and if you decide that you don't like the new mod go back to the save file before installing the mod. Save game corruption is never intentional, but it does happen when the game is expecting a line of code that is no longer there.
author: CamelSpyd3r

description:
Dialogue Expansion Project is an expansive mod aiming to add new, lore friendly, dialogue to every corner of the Kenshi world, bringing the world and it's people alive.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/NrstAKw.gif[/img]

I am planning to add unique dialogue to every faction and character. You can in fact see my plans here in this spreadsheet. This is just what is CURRENTLY planned. More will come as I add more.
[url=https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GCVAF5m9uklbqC2Aa3RJGPGQeLbqGGryF0TUHi-9-As/edit?usp=sharing]PLANNING DOCUMENT[/url]

As you can see so far I've only completed a small fraction of what I have planned.

[u][h1] LINE COUNT[/h1] [/u]
CUMULATIVE LINES ADDED: ~2,775

description:
This mod adds in two crafting benches, one for luxury goods and one for rugs. You can get access to the benches via research, under CORE.

You can craft multiple different misc. items such as Small Emperor Statue, Luxury Goods, Pearl Cup, etc. on the Luxury Goods Crafting bench.

[b]----------------------------------------------------[/b]

This mod adds

* The Fancy Rug Crafting bench lets you craft both Simple and Fancy rugs.

* Two storage barrels are added to help automate your crafting.

* Research for the new crafting benches

Please note, removal of mods can damage a save file. Importing after removal can fix the issue, but the import button is not magic. Back up your save game file before installing a new mod and if you decide that you don't like the new mod go back to the save file before installing the mod. Save game corruption is never intentional, but it does happen when the game is expecting a line of code that is no longer there.

description:
I'm just adding a little more life into the game. Should make the game easier but only in the sense that it adds some lore friendly stuff.

NPCs added so far:

Aspiring Mercenaries; Young mercenaries who can't justify to charge so much. Won't cost you more than a couple hundred cats. Squads range from 2 to 6 mercenaries, each merc is capable of handling 2-3 dust bandits on their own. I've placed them where they're most likely to survive their contracts with you - the Hub and in Holy Nation territory.

Pilgrim Faction/Pilgrims: Need to sneak into holy nation territory due to hostility or bounty? These guys will be wandering around HN territory completely unarmed and weak. They have their own faction, so the HN won't accuse you of uniform theft. Downside is that they're hard to find - they can occasionally be found wandering holy nation territories. Do remember that the HN can see through disguises if you're a skeleton.

Trade Ninja Caravan: Trade ninjas will now send caravans to you when you set up a base. They send 6 ninjas and a garru. They deal in just about everything, from books to materials to food to weapons. I'm... not sure about their acid protection, so if you want some free loot I guess set up in a really shitty place I guess.

---

I'll update this mod ever so often, usually to suite my own needs or desires. Mostly I want more outpost shenanigans as I find that having a base is kind of boring. The goal of the mod is to be as lore friendly as possible so I won't be adding any new factions aside from the pilgrim faction and a shek disguising faction (you can disguise as the slavers for the United Cities so I won't be adding one for them). 

Future Inhabitants of Kenshi:

A beggar visits your base
A (mean) beggar visits your base and insults you
United Cities sends ninjas to your base to gage your strength
Mercenary Guild employs disgraced Shek as Shek Kamikaze mercs for you to employ
A rich man and his annoying wife visit your base to do some shopping, hilarity right out of a 1980's sitcom ensues
Various groups of adventurers much like you, found roaming the world and may occasionally visit your base
Pilgrims visit your base and try to convert you to Okran
Pilgrims visit your base on a pilgrimmage (positive relations with Holy Nation)
Pilgrims visit your base and insult you (negative relations with Holy Nation)
(Rare event) Pilgrims hire assassins to kill you (negative relations with Holy Nation)
Hounds drug runners occasionally visiting your base/various cities
Probably more idk

All of those will be uncommon so as not to disrupt game play.

The biggest factor slowing this all down is that I am just so uninspired to do dialogue rn.

Whether or not an NPC will be recruitable with the prisoner recruitment mod depends on whether or not the mod owner merely changed dialogue packages or added dialogue to the character. If he changed the dialogue packages then they'll be as recruitable as their respective equivalents (ninja to ninja, merc to merc, pilgrim to holy nation civilian etc).

author: Seelenschwarz

description:
This is a mod that removes cut efficiency and applies that value towards cut resistance instead.

Let me tell you about Kenshi's cut efficiency. In theory, it's a nifty idea to have a certain percent of resisted cut damage to be converted to blunt damage instead. However, the execution is just ridiculous. You immediately take the blunt damage regardless of all subsequent layers of armor protecting that area. This results in absurd, backwards scenarios where wearing lower quality armor (or even none) can be superior to more layers of armor.

Here is an example:

Pretend you take a 100 cut damage hit to the right leg. You are wearing (all Masterwork) a Dustcoat, Samurai Legplates, and Samurai Boots. The Dustcoat has 60% coverage, meaning a 60% chance of blocking damage. If it does, you block 26 cut damage (44% Cut Resist * 60% Cut Efficiency) and you take an immediate 18 direct blunt damage (44 resisted - 26 blocked = 18 damage from inefficiency) from cut efficiency regardless of any other protection. The remaining 56 goes to the next layer. The Legplates have 100% chance to block 40 damage, take an immediate 5 damage (thanks efficiency), and the remaining 11 go to the next layer. The Boots have 100% efficiency, so you have a 40% chance to block 9 of 11 damage. So in total you take 25 or 34 damage.

Now if you TAKE OFF the Dustcoat (or the 40% chance it MISSES it), if you REMOVE that extra layer of protection, the Legplates receive all 100 damage. You block 73, take an immediate 8 damage (efficiency), and the remaining 19 goes to Boots. 40% chance the Boots will block 15 of 19 damage. In total, you take 12 or 27 damage.

Because of this backwards, awful efficiency system, you reduce more damage by striping off a Masterwork layer of protection than keeping it on. Even worse, wearing a PROTOTYPE Dustcoat reduces more damage than a Masterwork thanks to this system (take less direct damage from cut efficiency, more damage mitigated by Legplates).

This illogical system frustrated me to the point of making this mod. What it does is instead applies the efficiency value towards cut resistance, so a Dustcoat with 44% cut resist, 60% cut efficiency will instead have 26% cut resist (44% * 0.6). Using the previous example as a reference, the Dustcoat still blocks 26 cut damage but now all of the remaining 74 (56+18) goes onto the next layer. No immediate direct damage ignoring all other armor. No dumb "More protection is worse protection" absurd scenarios. 

That's it. There are no other special tweaks or adjustments to give a player advantages or disadvantages. Just removing cut efficiency and adjusting cut resistance to account for it. This will make characters, both player and enemy, a bit more resilient to cut damage as they are no longer taking magic direct damage.

****

[h1]"Why not just have the converted cut-to-blunt damage pass to the next layer instead of removing Cut Efficiency entirely?"[/h1]

Since about half of this mod's comments are asking about this, I'll put the answer here. The reason is because I can't. So far as I'm aware, modders have no access to the game's formulas or calculations. This mod is a workaround that still passes the damage to the next layer but without converting it to blunt. It is an imperfect solution, but that's all I can do with the FCS toolset. Only the dev could change the actual calculation to pass the converted blunt on.

****

[h1]"What about armors introduced by other mods?"[/h1]

This mod does not alter a single non-vanilla armor. However, I recently did work some of the more popular.

NCE for Gusoku Armor Set:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1817569665

NCE for Mediocre Black Armor:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1817606982

----

Also, another modder by the name of blot made several additional NCE patches for other armor mods. I double-checked blot's numbers for the new cut resistances (adjusted to account for removed cut efficiency) and, while not perfect for every single piece, the most deviation I saw was 1-2% on a couple of the Masterwork versions (ie, 52% instead of the expected 51%). Not too shabby for the volume of patches he made. If you're interested, here's the list:

NCE for OMO'S ARMOUR for the World:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1830612586

NCE for More Plate Options:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1830613354

NCE for Dread Gear:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1830578945

NCE for Dread Bindings:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1830579476

NCE for Wolf Headgear:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1830580832

NCE for Impaler Armor Set:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1830581571

----

Yet another modder by the name of Thundercraft made several additional NCE patches for other armor mods. If you're interested, here's the list:

NCE for Unique Phoenix Armor:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1994389873

NCE for Black Dragon Ninja Armour:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1994504948

NCE for The Dust King:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1994513031

NCE for "Wear your hats with everything":
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2002916934


****

Compatibility:

This mod edits "cut def bonus" and "cut into stun" values for every piece of armor with cut efficiency. If you have another mod that edits those values, place this above or below it in your load order depending on which mod's effects you prefer (put the one you prefer lower in the list). It does not modify any armors outside of the vanilla game.

****

(2020-03-05)
Update to included Monk Robe, Black Rag Shirt, and Holy Servant Rags.

(2020-03-02)
Added Thundercraft's patches to the list for non-vanilla armor mods. Download them separately from the links above.

(2019-09-06)
Added a guide in the Discussions page for how to make your own NCE edits for armors from other mods.

(2019-08-25)
Added blot's patches to the list for non-vanilla armor mods. Download them separately from the links above.

(2019-07-28)
Made 2 patches to non-vanilla armor mods. Download them separately from the links above.

(2019-07-18) v3
Update to included Dyed Robes.

(2019-07-17) v2
Update to include the three versions of Halfpants I had missed.

(2019-07-16) v1
This is the first version of the mod, which I'm calling version 0.9. I've combed through all the armors multiple times to make sure I did not miss any, and I've checked dozens of sets of armors to make sure all the cut resistance values are right across varying qualities. However, I am still human and may have still missed one or fudged a value somewhere. Let me know if you find any armor showing unusual resistances or still depicting cut resistance, and I'll try to fix it right up.

Lastly, because of some hidden scales and values I cannot predict, a few of lower quality versions of armors may be 1% off of their expected resistance due to rounding errors. The mod edited every Masterwork to its new cut resistance and lets the quality system take care of the rest.

Enjoy.

description:
[h1][i]Welcome, no-hive!  Are you tired of having floppy leg-ends and all those excessive amounts of fingers?  Or maybe you're one of those.. [b]hiveless[/b]... that is tired of having floppy robot appendages when a beak thing ate your limbs because you disobeyed our glorious Queen! 

Well look no further! Our finest of Hive roboticists have developed a line of the greatest robotic limbs you love, (besides our own economically produced limbs, of course!) without those floppy leg-hands and a much more reasonable amount of fingers! Get them today at your local Hive Roboticist while our supplies last!**[/i]



**Disclaimer: Service to hiveless Queen disobeying scum is not guaranteed. Get your own robot bench and make your own! [b]GET OUT![/b][/h1]


This mod adds Hive-compatible versions of all robotic limbs, available (rarely) at Hive robotic vendors, and also craftable at the Skeleton Limb bench. Crafting is unlocked through the base game robot limb research, with an added [b]Hive Specialty Limbs[/b] research to craft the Steady arm and Thief arm.

Hive versions of robot limbs have only 3 fingers, and lower legs have a more blade-like appearance. They are functionally identical to the original limbs. They do not replace the original robot limbs. All robot limbs can be worn by any race.
author: Wunkay

description:
Mercenary Reworked By PositiveBuff
-----------------------------------------------------------
The main idea of this Mod is improving and refining the rough mercenary mechanism of the vanilla Kenshi (for example, the price of most vanilla employable squads is 2000 cats per day even their combat ability are different or their number are different). I also add some stories and dialogs about the background of Mercenary Guild.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Brief Introduction:
1. The price of mercenaries and other squads will be determined by the ability and quantity of mercenaries. Human mercenaries in the Holy Nation are cheaper, while Tech Hunter squads are expensive.

2. Most employers need to pay a large deposit in advance to prevent casualties (especially death or disability). But some employers have earned the trust of mercenaries and no deposit is needed.
3. The Mercenary Guild refuse to serve the employers on the blacklist. These employers had let loyal mercenaries execute suicide missions.
4. Mercenary Guild managers work in some bars, and employers can ask them to retrieve their deposits when the contract is completed. You can ask them for stories about the guild and the deposit.
5. The Wandering Trader (the game start) has earned trust of mercenaries in some past, so no deposit is needed.
6. At the end of the bodyguard mission, renewals can be made. The contract will be extended for one day. The conditions for renewal are that the mercenaries are not seriously injured; there is no ongoing battle; the employer and mercenary squad leader is close enough to active a dialogue.
7. Mercenary Guild managers can help you post some notices and summon interested Tech Hunter squads to your outpost for defensive missions. The higher reward attached to the notice, the higher probability of the present of Tech Hunter squads, the earlier their arrival, and the larger number of the squad.
8. Further refine the interesting employable faction Black Dog, adding background stories and a little plot between the Black Dog and the Mercenary Guild. Players can tap into the secrets by listening the conversation between the two sides, exploring the Black Dog HQ and some bar chats.

If you are interested in this mod, please explore in the game and may find some more interesting contexts~
-----------------------------------------------------------
Matters needing attention:

Old saves need to be imported.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Recent updates:
- Squads over 20 people can be hired now (but need much more cats to unlock the hire option).
- Some changes to improve potential compatibility with other mods.
- Add a stronger mercenary squad if the Mercenary Guild take over the Manhunter base.
author: PositiveBuff

description:
HUMAN! Why do you live in those stone buildings? You'll starve in there!

Build hive buildings. Much nicer! Queen approved!

We even have huts that look like your own silly human buildings, like the stormhouse and the swamp dome and the hive stationhouse and... well that's it but you will like them human!

Come sit in our very own hive stool, hand crafted by master hive builders!

Sleep in hive beds! Much nicer than sleeping on the ground.

Decorate your hive with fur rugs, no need for smelly, nasty fAnCy RuGs!

You can even cook like hive! Human, keep this a secret! Only hive know the BEST way to cook is in the open air. Campfire Cookpot, Queen loves it!

Do you like hive robot limbs human? We know you do! You can have best Hive Robotic Limb crafting bench of your very own. The rust gives character it's how you know it is the number one crafting bench!

And lastly, human, we hive will let you build your very own hive table! It is not magic, but the wonders of hive technology. You need place to put a cup, table holds cup off the floor, you need place to put food, table also keeps food from falling to floor! It is amazing!

Hurry human! Build these number one, best, a-okay items today!

[b]------------------------------------------------------[/b]

This mod adds

* Hive House - a hive building based off of the L-House

* Hive Dome - a hive building based off of the Swamp Dome

*Hive Stationhouse - a building fit for a queen, based of the Stationhouse

* Hive Bed - this bed heals at 6x, better than a sleeping bag (4x) but not as well as a human bed (8x)

* Fur Rug - available in white and black these fur rugs are made from animal skin and are purely decorative

* Hive Skeleton Limb Bench - it's rusting and falling apart but it's smaller than a traditional crafting bench and you can craft economy limbs at it

* Hive Stool - made from discarded parts of skeletons it's the perfect place for your workers to take a load off if they have nothing to do

* Campfire Cooking Pot - a cooking method when you're away from home or you just want another model to use for cooking, functions like a cookstove

* Hive Table - made from broken economy limbs, it's a table. That's it. Used for decorating your buildings

* All buildings and furniture are researchable at a research bench
author: CamelSpyd3r

description:
How is this different than other color mods?

Most of them dye armor using the existing colormaps in the game - a splotch on the chest, a spot on the head.

I have redone (or created new) colormaps for most of the armor in the game - that is, defining WHERE on the armor your colors show. Instead of "splotch on chest," the entire armor is now colored.

This affects all NPC factions as well - now they look distinct and show their true colors.

I have preserved details like material texture, leather straps, metal rivets, etc. instead of just "dipped in a paint bucket" effect that turns everything to mud.

BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE

In 30 seconds you can customize the player's faction colors to anything you want. All armor you wear in game will become this color scheme. Tired of those colors? 30 more seconds to change it. Make a dozen different settings for my mod, and choose whichever color scheme you feel like using when you start the game!

HOW I DO DIS

I will make a video if this isn't clear, but it's super simple.

Start Kenshi in Steam
Open the FCS
Click the button to make a new mod, making sure only the game's 4 base files, in the top box, are checked.
Name it anything you want, like "MyFirstColorScheme," or "BlueAndGrey," or "Humphrey."

On the left, click on COLOUR SCHEME.
Rightclick anywhere in the right and click NEW ITEM
Make the name NamelessPlayer
^^^^ YOU MUST NAME IT EXACTLY THAT, NamelessPlayer ^^^^^
Click Color1. Click the button on the right. Ooooo, a color palette appears!
Choose your favorite color. This is now your faction's PRIMARY color.
Click Color 2. Click the button. I'm sure you can guess the rest. This is now your faction's SECONDARY color.

Save mod.

Close FCS.

Start Kenshi.

Activate your file you just made in the MODS list and Save changes. MAKE SURE YOUR FILE IS BELOW MINE IN THE LIST, OF COURSE.

Now your choices are your faction colors.

Starting a new playthrough? Feel like RPing a different group?
Wait, don't edit your first file! Make another one, with a differnet name!
Make as many as you want! When you get bored with one colorscheme, deselect it in the Mods list, and activate a different one!

I feel like it's in good shape for a 1.0 release, so here it is. I will likely continue to improve the textures and maps based on feedback, or finding mistakes, or sudden whim at 2 AM on a Saturday night.
author: spacefiddle

description:
This mod is based on a comment from Chris Hunt, the creator of Kenshi, duing the recent AMA on reddit.

"I usually trade and wander and get into scrapes, I think that's the most fun way to play. I frown upon mining as an income source. In the future I might make it harder, like rival miners or town guards demanding you have a mining licence or something."

This got me thinking, we already have the tools to make this possible in the FCS. So I set up a tariff on copper.

What this mod does is add dialogue triggers to shop keepers and united city gate guards to stop you if you have copper in your inventory.

The gate guards will search your bag, and if you have any copper, they will demand 5000 cats as a tariff on the copper. The tariff is waved if you have a copper trading writ, which can be purchased from Yamdu at Trader's edge. You can also try to bribe the guards to let you through or run away.

Merchants will now refuse to trade with you if you have copper, unless you have a copper trading writ. You can also try to bribe them to let you trade anyways.

The main goal of this mod is to remove the easy money that copper mining provides in the early game and hopefully add a little complexity to the trading systems. If this mod proves popular, I'll expand it to include other resources, implement different tariffs for different factions, and make it so that most traders require a license before trading.

description:
For Kenshi players who want to see a wide variety of NPC names, this mod adds 2870 male, 1573 female, and 643 unisex names to the game.

Represented are names from a variety of cultures. To match the distribution of names seen in the unmodified game, most are of East Asian or Latin origin, and almost half of the new names are Japanese. Obscenities are not included, untoward names are avoided (if you see one, it's likely one of the default names).

The default names included with the game are not removed, but you'll be much less likely to see two people with the same name (for example, the chances for any one female name are 1:104 default, vs. 1:4361 modded, ~0.96% to ~0.023%).

The files themselves are only a few kilobytes in size, and this mod does not appear to affect game performance. The lists are not weighted, each name has an equal chance of selection.

Compatibility Note: Mods that alter the name lists probably cannot be combined, but I haven't actually tested it. If someone knows otherwise, please leave a comment.

Sources:
Wikipedia and Wiktionary
20000-names.com
U.S. Social Security Administration
Some Tibetan names sourced from kadampa-center.org

description:
Do you want a playable Hiver Queen in your life, but don't like some of the graphical elements I won't mention here because they may be spoilers? Then our patented Hive Princess  is for you! This highly uncustomizable addition to your world features;

No Pheromones: Don't worry about being mentally enslaved and cursed to live a pitiful existence of servitude! Your playable queen features none of this!

Clipping Issues: I did my best but there might be some interesting relationships between headgear and your new Hiver Princessn. I recommend Armored Face Plates for your beefy Warrior Princesses.

Maybe Too Big: She's kinda big. There's not much to say here, sometimes the game gets silly with Shek-sized models. She looks fantastic with heavy weapons and kind of silly with polearms or shorter katanas.

Tenuous Lore Compatibility: We all know there is just the ONE TRUE QUEEN that we all should worship and serve faithfully while shunning the hiveless ones. But let's just pretend that, sometimes, somewhere a little magic happens and a sterile queen-like hiver  is created. I wanted to make a custom crafting station that took meat and skins and created drones but I couldn't figure it out. :( Also she is just a regular hiver genderwise because I found a whooooole lot of weird clipping issues when setting a hiver body to female.

Questionable Balance Decisions: The Hive Queen is a singular high maintenance unit that features higher than average hiver health [100hp limbs, 150hp head], fast regeneration [a blazing 2x modifer!] but middling skill aptitudes [++medic ++toughness, --farming --laboring --perception] and middling stat aptitudes [+10% Dex and Str]. Her combat speed multiplier is the same as a Hiver Soldier Drone.

------------------

Compatibility Patches: Make sure these go below the Clean Queen mod and the other mod in question.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1863611717]Race Blood[/url]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1870435613]Animation Overhaul Mod - Crafting[/url]

------------------

Once you import your save or start a new game you should be able to find a unique Hiver Princess hanging out at the bar in The Hub named Bugmom! You may also spot them in the wild hanging out in bars, at approximately 1/5th the rate of Hiver Princes. Rare, but not impossible!

description:
Legend of the Mist Ghoul
“	Sightings of hovering ghoulish creatures from the misty caverns west of the Holy Nation plains. The ghouls possess elongated, black frames with long fingers, glowing eyes and a mouth that stretches to the size of a full grown man.
Travellers who delve into the mist are renowned for not returning again, until further notice expeditions are to be avoided in the area.

- Idad ”

In the same style as my previous Grievewraith mod, this aims to bring one of the legends to life in the form of a new and interesting enemy.

Fogmen are scary enough but have you ever wondered if there's anything worse lurking in the mist? The mist ghouls have you covered. They don't eat, don't bleed, don't talk, are unnaturally fast and incredibly tough. 

They're not common by any stretch of the imagination... You'd be lucky to spot one at all when travelling through the islands. Though... They say that the deepest areas of the fog hold terrors unimaginable... Or you could just follow the trails of dead fogmen.
They mostly come in 3 different forms with their own little quirks:

- Mist Fiend: Scrawny and REALLY quick, you ain't running away from these.
- Mist Ghoul: Middle man, most common variant and usually spawn in pairs or in groups with Fiends.
- Mist Horror: Big and scary, especially tough and commonly seen alone.
- ???

They all have fairly low defence (not much but enough to defend themselves from low level characters). However their attacks are damn near unblockable. The trick is to overwhelm them before they overwhelm you.

The mod also adds in 2 new weapons:

- Forked Cleaver: Sometimes used by the ghouls (Blueprints can be found in Mongrel).
- ???

Other Legends:
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1729572902] Grievewraiths [/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1882920758] Foulhounds [/url]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1877769051] Combat animation mods compatibility [/url]

description:
This mod adds a heavier version of the mercenary plate armor. It is essentially an unholy chest plate with the pauldrons and arm plates of mercenary plate, plus some armor for the back. It has slightly better protection than the unholy chest plate and covers 80% of the arms, rather than 25%, but is more expensive, significantly heavier, and has higher combat penalties because of all the extra bulk. The armor and its blueprint are sold anywhere the unholy chest plate is.

Version 10 Update:
-Overhauled the textures to be less glossy and also a bit less filthy.

Version 9 Update:
-Fixed most of the weird stretching issues, particularly in the chest/stomach/waist area of female characters (finally - Kenshi is so weird in how they do female armatures and fixing this took me ages)
-Further dirtied the armor

Version 8 Update:
-Added weathering effects to the armor's texture
-Reduced glossiness
-The shoulder straps now move with your shoulders
-Added dust storm protection to the helmet and a little acid protection to the chest and leg pieces
-Compressed the textures to reduce file size

Version 7 Update:
-Added faction colors. Since this might not be to everyone's taste, I added them as a separate patch, found here https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1905943482 .
-This will probably be the last change I make to this mod, unless any major issues pop up, as I'm happy with it in its current state and tinkering can be all-consuming if you let it be.

Version 6 Update:
-Added pants and boots! Now you can collect the whole heavy set.

Version 5 Update:
-Added a helmet! The Mercenary Bascinet is now available, both as an item and a blueprint, at the same vendors where you'd buy the armor. It is statted as a heavy version of the visored helmet, and all that entails.
-Updated the armor's texture (again).
-Note that if you look up at the helmet from underneath, parts of the inside may look invisible. This is something I just noticed and will try to fix in the next update, but it's not a very noticeable thing.
-The helmet's base model was a free download from the lovely www.cgtrader.com, which has plenty of good stuff I may use in future updates. All credit goes to them - I mostly just made it work with Kenshi.

Version 4 Update:
-Updated the textures to be a little more grey and a little less brown. Also added some high/low-lighting for more detail.
-Removed the worst of the clipping issues, particularly on female characters. Note that characters with particularly small waists or large chests will still get some weird clipping.
-Updated the icon to better reflect the new texture.

Version 3 Update:
-Female textures should now be working properly.
-Improved (hopefully) the textures all around to better fit the game's color scheme.

author: BigTino

description:
There's some music in the game that's far too overpowering, but not in a good way.  The volume is just way too loud.

In an attempt to not feel like I've suddenly walked into a frickin' subwoofer set to over 9,000, I've lowered the volume on music files that abuse decibels worse than a shady underground nightclub.
Specifically, I've lowered the decibel count by 5 all across the board, so it's not going to be volume-abusive but the emotion and atmospheric quality is still there.

There are probably other pieces of music that are too loud, so if anyone notices any then let me know where you were in the game at the time the music played (the more precise, the better).

So far, the following music files have been tweaked:

**Dunes_Music_Bank.BNK**
- 0020.WEP
- 0025.WEP
- 0032.WEP
- 0054.WEP

**Savannah_Music_Bank.BNK**
- 0019.WEP
- 0032.WEP
- 0044.WEP
- 0050.WEP
- 0058.WEP
- 0068.WEP

**Swamplands_Music_Bank.BNK**
- 0026.WEP
- 0038.WEP
- 0040.WEP
- 0055.WEP

**Tarsands_Music_Bank.BNK**
- 0002.WEP
- 0019.WEP
- 0020.WEP
- 0048.WEP

Although the game originally plays music as .WEP audio files within their .BNK archives, this mod leaves the tweaked individual music files as .OGG, which is a lossless format.
Lossless format has a much larger file size compared to compressed alternatives, so I may consider recompressing all tweaked audio back into .WEP in the near future.

As of version 5 (Steam Workshop version) of Don't Burst My Ear Drums, I think I've found and tweaked all of the major culprits of decibel abuse, but I'll continue to test further and see (or hear) if anything else crops up.

description:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/p7Fv1Z6.gif[/img]

This mod aims to add more realism to combat. 
Unlocking attack slots was neccesary, but that is not enough and it didn't felt right, therefore blocking chance and atack chance have been reworked. Skill will be more relevant than ever when being outnumbered, this mod is not intended for new players, it will make combat harder  but more rewarding with proper training. To be clear, block and dodge are now crucial, train them and you'll be unstoppable.    

Features (short read):

- Unlocks attack slots x3 
- Reworked block chance %, 
- Reworked attack chance %,
- Adds organ damage to blunt attacks, 
- Cuts cause more immediate blood loss 
- Changed max and min damage resistance (achieved by leveling toughness)
- Damage resistance from a hit can be random (up to the char max) and will not be always stick to a fix value

Features (long read):

If the attack lvl is equal to your opponents defense lvl then you will have an 85% block chance (70% was vanilla) , every +10 lvl diff you will get 5% extra block chance (10% vanilla) , every -10 lvl diff will lead to a penalizing -15% block chance. Also, if you are +10 attack levels higher you will have 1.75x more attacks than your opponent (1.5x vainilla). That will mean that if you are skilled enough, even outnumbered you can block most hits and get more hits also into the opponents. The max/min damage reduction has been increased to be more dependent on toughness , you can now deduct 85% of the max damage instead of 65% vanilla and the stumble damage is now 120 instead of 80 (vainilla). 
Immediate blood loss for cuts has been increased to 0.3 (0.2 vanilla) and now blunt weapons have 0.1 organ damage (0 vainilla), also , damage reduction is not fixed anymore (it is random up to the max/min).

To clarify a bit on blunt weapon organ internal damage:

OrganDamage = BluntDamage * 0.1
OrganStun = BluntDamage * (1 - 0.1)

It was a deactivated mechanic in the game (value=0) which I decided to re-activate, this made sense for blunt weapons, if you get hit by a big mace in the chest (IRL) you will notice the described effects.

Compatibility:

- All mods

To support my work and the time I spent feel free to donate to my PayPalMe.

[url=paypal.me/nicolasmd87] [img]https://i.imgur.com/gmaqOA3.png[/img] [/url]

I would reccomend donating to all mods you consider worth it, they are essentially free DLCs.

[b]My other mods:[b]

Rebel Farmers Overhaul - Uprise against the UC (+new start as the Rebel Farmer Revolutionary):

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1890360942]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1890360942[/url]

Fort Simion Expanded:

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1897762637]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1897762637[/url]


[b]Please comment and rate ! Rating helps the community determine a mod is working properly or not, take your time and do it properly.[b]
