author: SpaceMinion / Minion

description:
Trade, Items, and Trade Items Economy - Compatable edition

Built on jbra1's Trade Routes Intensified( https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1658170081 ), this mod attempts to make trade a bit more "immerisive" by adding weight to a handful of items to encourage pack animal use, tweaking jbra1'a modifiers down, and adding a few new items to give you a reason to visit regions that you might otherwise avoid.

Firstly, if you prefer jbra1's more generous pricing, simply load Trade Routes Intensified lower than this mod in your load order. This mod does NOT require TRI, but I built the mod to work together because his is the the trade mod that's I've used the most and which seems to generally go in the direction I like. I will be working on a version of this mod that will be more 'stand-alone' since I've come to the conclusion that I don't actually like a bunch of trade modifiers everywhere and that I want to give many regions a unique item or two instead. 

---------------

Alright, what this mod does:

1) Adds 4 new trade goods to the game,

Eles-Seeoh, from Mongrel. Mongrel doesn't have a lot going for it, but it's got an oil pump, so... Okranites call it the Bile of Narko so maybe don't go rolling into Blister Hill with a pack of this stuff.

Fish Oil. Most fish sellers have a chance of stocking some of this stuff, and in keeping with TRI's theme, the Shek like it. 

Infused Sake. Drifter's Last supplies this regional variation on the popular drink. 

Slave Filler. The Holy Nation allows some merchants to sell this cheap 'food' to traders. It's unsurprisingly not at all popular with anyone who cares about their food.

It shouldn't be much work to figure out who pays a premium on these items. A few of them might show up as items laying about in some places.

2) Item weights. I don't like how you can carry an entire building in your backpack without much effort, so I greatly increased the weight of raw stone, raw iron, copper, building materials, iron plates, copper plates, and steel. They aren't so heavy as to be impossible to move, but they'll definitely train your strength for a while if you're in the habbit of filling packs up with rocks. A full load of building materials will weigh down a pack bull now, but that just gives you a reason to get more bulls. Or just make everyone carry bricks, I dunno.

3) Price tweaks. I lowered TRI's price modifiers down to mostly 125%-150%. I left some high, usually items that can only be found or are justifiably rare or hard to get at those locations. Or if a 50% difference wouldn't make much difference anyway. I lowered Flotsam prices because they don't stay bottled up in nowhere forever, but they now pay increased prices for hemp, fabrics, building materials, and iron plates as they like to make their own stuff and are in a position to build. The holy nation now supplies parchment, skins, and meat at a discount since they have a strong ranch culture.

And that's about it. This is mostly a personal mod project but I am thinking I may expand on the idea of regional items in the nearish future. Feedback is welcome, I've been playing with it a little while but I still might have missed some odd behavior. 

The mod is pretty benign, and shouldn't conflict with anything. Mods that change vendors around a bit might result in these items popping up in weird places, but probably not.

V.2 -> Reduces weights on materials and plates quite a bit, though raw iron, copper, water, oil,  and stone are still fairly hefty. High demand market for oil now pays 25% more (175%) to make account for such hostile territory. Certain crustacean-aligned groups now pay a bit more for fish oil, if you can sell to them.

Fixed slave trader prices for Slave Filler, I had missed that there's a 50% deduction on their merchants for everything. They should pay an extra 50% now. Mongrel now pays a small premium on Filler as well, as their food situation is supposedly tenuous.

v3 -> Decreased oil weight down to 16kg a pop. It'll still weigh down a fully loaded pack for just about anyone but now one can fit a fair number on an adult pack animal before they get weighed down.

author: ikahurula

description:
This is a patch for Circumsoldier's "Hives Expanded" mod that removes the cut efficiency stat for all of the mod's armor, and adjusts the cut resistance stat in accordance with the formula developed by Lyston for the No Cut Efficiency mod.

A brief explaination:

By default, Kenshi's "Cut Efficiency" stat converts some cutting damage into blunt damage, and then you take that blunt damage directly. On paper this seems like it makes sense, but the game does not take layers into account when it decides to just give you that blunt damage, which leads to situations where you'd want outer later armor with low cut efficiency so that you take less blunt damage up front and the remaining damage has a chance to just be straight up ignored by your stronger inner layers. In this system, having a prototype dustcoat (or nothing at all) over your armor is better for your survival than having a masterwork grade dustcoat.

This formula aims to just simplify the whole system and remove some of that "more protection equals worse protection" nonsense. You may find the game is a little deadlier, especially when it comes to cutting weapons, but now those heavy armors are worth a lot more defensively.

Please see Lyston's "No Cut Efficiency" mod for more details.

This mod requires "Hives Expanded" by Circumsoldier.

description:
This mod modifies typical caravan of Slave Traders in order to make them little bit more agressive and profit-seeking.
While this is standalone mod, it was actually created with another, custom slavery mod (on which one I'm currently working) in mind. Although without player faction slavery, it still provides some minor tuning to default caravans.

Features (as of Beta 11dec2019):
- slave trader caravans guards are now little bit more agressive and will not hesitate to grab and enslave any weak defenceless character, although they should not step into direct confrontation with just anyone (they are traders, not hunters).
- caravan boss now have his own non-complicated trader dialogue.
- same caravan boss now can buy your stuff (following UC trade philosophy, which can be moddable on its own) or sell some medkits or food to you.
- freshly spawned caravans now having chance to have up to 5 slaves they transporting for sell to town NPCs or to player.
- caravan boss now not only sells his slaves, but also can buy yours.
author: Kimm Orwente

description:
MODname：Fix Relation(Healing)EN

When you heal someone and save his life, I think you can be more grateful.
This mod modifies the relationship with them when healing is complete.

1. Have both a first aid kit and a robot repair kit. (not "or".regardless of their race )
2. Heal the NPC and complete it.
3. The first message is displayed.(Encourage, caring)
4. The second message is displayed with a certain probability, and the relationship improves. (1 point)

The chance of seeing the second message is 33% for small factions and 22% for large factions.
Factions with alliance events often have a 22% chance(HN,UC,Revel Farmer,Anti-Slaver,etc)

One treatment may improve the relationship between the two factions.
For example, treating UC also improves police relationships. The reverse is also true.
Treating man hunters will improve the relationship of slave traders as well as man hunters.
Conversely, treating slave traders does not improve the relationship of man hunters.

Most factions are included, including cannibals. However, some factions such as wild animals are not eligible.
Factions added by MOD are also not eligible.
author: condor

description:
Revamped and Expanded all vanilla manufacturers. Since the manufacturers themselves are by default referenced in the game, all modification should apply immediately upon the game loading in new data.

All existing weaponry in a save should update with new values too.

All grades from:
Unknown -> Cross

Revamped to have a leveled scaling of damage multipliers and attack/defense modifiers, in addition to new models within certain manufacturers that applies 'alternative set of buffs (all attack, balanced, all defense).

In a sense it makes combat slightly harder and easier at the same time:
- Unknown weapons at the low end has greater debuff to stats, up to Ancient with so-so, and weaker damage output than usual, but at the high end nearly as good as early Catun gear.

- Starting at around Skeleton Smiths, buffs starts to be very high overall, meaning every NPC using one are boosted, and the damage output from Catun and above is slightly stronger, with the weight adjusted as well.

- At the highest point, is two additional Meitou models, and Meitou (default) itself is nerfed a little to allow 2 models to fit above, with the best possible model having +10 Atk/Def and really high damage multiplier for the Cross manufacturer with it's weight being high as well.

author: Red Cloud

description:
Did you know that hammerhead shark eyes are mounted on the sides because it allows 360° of vision in the vertical plane, meaning the animals can see above and below them at all times?
Well then why do Hive Soldier Drones have NEGATIVE Perception??!?

Hive Soldiers are arguably the weakest race in the game, having 9 negative skills and only 2 positive skills. They also cannot wear helms making them vulnerable to Duststorms and Gas.

This mod aims to fix all of these problems, first with some stat tweaks and then with an added item available in Hive Villages. These changes apply to both Western and Southern Hive Soldiers.

Stat Tweaks:
0% Perception changed from -20% Perception
+20% Polearm changed from 0% Polearm
100% Duststorm Immunity changed from 0% Duststorm Immunity
1.4 Vision Range Multiplier changed from 1.0 Vision Range Multiplier

New Item:
Hive Soldier Gas Mask which can be equipped in the belt slot. Specifically designed for Hive Soldiers, it can only be worn by them. It provides 100% Weather Protection against Gas and it also has 5% head coverage, so you may get lucky and it can save your life! The resistance stats are identical to the Swamp Ninja Mask; details located in this wiki link: https://kenshi.fandom.com/wiki/Swamp_Ninja_Mask

The Hive Soldier Gas Mask and blueprint are sold in Hive Villages. In case you are roleplaying an exiled Hiver that cannot return to the villages, the blueprint is also rarely sold at The Great Library in Black Scratch.

Because of their hammerhead like features, it made no sense to me that they'd have lesser Perception and I even contemplated buffing it, but since Hive Princes already get a bonus to Perception, I wanted Hive Soldiers to feel more unique. After much consideration a Polearm bonus made sense because that is literally what every Hive Soldier spawns equipped with.

I decided that their unique head shape contributes to their ability to see in Duststorms (hence the 100% Immunity) and I also gave them a large vision range. This only effects NPCs and makes it much harder to run through Hiver terrority unseen. This is especially noticable when running through Southern Hiver territory as Soldier patrols will become aggressive from much further away. 

This mod can be kept fairly high in load order as long as you don't have any other mods directly buffing Hive Soldiers. Even if you're using mods that heavily edit Western Hive Villages, you can always rely on buying the Gas Mask blueprint at The Great Library in Black Scratch, but since this mod adds the item to the vendor list, it should still show up in most cases. 

This mod should be 100% compatible with Hives Expanded since the only edits to Hive Soldiers from Hives Expanded are the gear they spawn with. Hives Expanded is a great mod and I highly suggest giving it a try: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1688546539

P.S. There are many mods that buff Hive Soldiers, but I've found the other mods do not do this in a lore friendly way. Why would Hivers suddenly become immune to Gas? I believe it is more lore friendly that Hivers would have invented a custom gas mask rather than suddenly become immune to Gas.

If you like my mod, feel free to hit that 👍
Positive ratings help me know I'm doing a good job 😊
I also appreciate positive feedback, feel free to leave a comment, or come chat with me live! I stream on Twitch, Tuesdays through Saturdays starting at 1PM EST!
https://www.twitch.tv/2PercentNate

My workshop page featuring more of my Kenshi mods:
https://steamcommunity.com/id/2PercentNate/myworkshopfiles/?appid=233860

description:
The longhouse building was so difficult to place as to be effectively unplaceable, so I made it placeable!

I made this mod to supplement Slopeless and DungeonRyu's GenMod Slopeless DLC1. It addresses some issues I had with the longhouse building in exactly the same manner as Slopeless.

Among other buildings, it should enable you to place the longhouse with eased restrictions as to slope and height.

This mod now requires both Genmod and Forgotten Buildings, and must be placed after it in your load order. You may want to place it after anything else that modifies the buildings involved, but this probably won't be necessary.

I apologize for the change in dependencies, but these mods are being developed primarily for my own play environment. You *could* probably use it without GenMod or Forgotten Buildings without anything bad happening, but it will probably throw errors in the launcher. However, if there is a demand for it, I will make versions with as few dependencies as possible.

No import required.

--UPDATE--

Now also supports:

-Default Stationhouse
-All Snailhouse versions
-Default Stormhouse
-Default Bughouse
-Default L-House
-Default Y-House
-Watchtower
-Moor House C
-Small and Large Water Towers
- all standard sheds from GenMod (finally works now!)

-----------------------------------------

SHAMELESS PLUG FOR MY OTHER MODS

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2004970354]Drugs Expanded Patch, GenMod Version[/url] - add a variety of craftable drugs for trading or smuggling.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2018422570]Better Crop Fences for Drugs Expanded[/url] - patches the GenMod version of the Drugs Expanded Patch to use higher quality crop fences!

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2002781355]LonghouseAdjustment[/url] (poorly named mod that allows you to more easily place various buildings. Like Slopeless, only it covers buildings Slopeless forgot.)

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2002929848]Manufacturers Expanded - Craftable[/url] - small patch for manufacturers expanded.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2018418662]Slowheal[/url] - Drastically increased healing times, intended to be used with large size player factions. Helps to balance having so many warriors at your disposal. Pairs well with Bleed Out!

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2018408113]Bleed Out![/url] - Drastically increased blood loss and wound fester times. Pairs well with Slowheal. Be careful using this with solo character runs.


-----------------------------------------

MY PERSONAL MODLIST

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2018469978]Mino's Modlist - A Highly Customized GenMod Experience[/url], or a modlist for the insane. Give it a try!

description:
A mod to increase recruitment and squad limit.

Increases recruitable units to 256
Increases maximum members in squads to 50
Increases maximum squad limit to 20

That's it. No hidden bee pie in this one, sorry.

**Other mods that change the same variables may interfere with this one. To make sure these are the finalized variables that Kenshi uses, please place this mod on the very bottom of the mod loading order, even if other mods ask you to place theirs on the bottom. Doing so will not cause any disruptions in the operation of other mods - It will only ensure the changes this mod makes are prioritized over other mods changing the same variable.

description:
Craftable swords for training that deal 0 damage. To be used along with a captured bandit to train your squad.

Requires Training Swords research to craft, which is unlocked by Weapon Smithing research.

NOTE FOR TRAINING MARTIAL ARTS:
Characters using training binds WILL TAKE DAMAGE WHEN ATTACKING. This is because the training binds do not give 100% fist protection and happens only WHEN YOUR CHARACTERS HAVE LOW MARTIAL SKILL. This is to give you an idea of when your characters are ready to punch people without breaking their limbs and to help build toughness.

description:
Lofigames Official Forums Page: http://www.lofigames.com/phpBB3/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=8386
Nexus Mod Page: http://www.nexusmods.com/kenshi/mods/searchresults/?src_cat=1

A relatively low-key mod that adds in a multitude of Unique followers who will each have their own unique set of dialogue and dialogue package.

The mod also aims to achieve to give each unique follower its own dialogue package or otherwise improve them if one already exists.

The mod includes a variety of basic followers which will allow you to diversify your squads' skillsets, appearances, in-game lore, and your own cute little head canons. 

Unique Followers include: Grimm, Yunomi, Mikael, L' Cie, Okuro, Katharciss, Optic, Orphis, Palach, Pepssim, Opsmit, Gnume, Ordis, Eldritch, Potpourri, Kazakh, Tyran, Delend, Arien, Tortuga, Elizabeth, Irdat, Slezkh, Josef, and Yiannas.

Please note that Unique Followers will "Fast Join" your squad, meaning you will not be able to edit them without taking them to a plastic surgeon. This is intended. I did this to showcase the unique followers as presented, make the game feel more as if you are simply another person wandering Kenshi's roads, (I wonder what they'll name the continent...), and also to prevent crashes regarding Katharciss and Delend's cannibal tattoos in the editor.

Basic Followers include: Thieves for Hire, Wayfaring Monks, Disgraced Ninja, Out of Luck Shop Keepers, Bored Citzens, Bored Farmers, Bored Shop Guards, Beggars, Disillusioned Slavers, Embezzlers, Heretics, Escaped Slaves, Ex-Caravan Guards, Ex-Cops, Exiles, Failed Samurai Recruits; Mercenary Captains, Heavies, and Soldiers; Reformed Bandits, Ronin, Tribal Shek Warriors,Broken Thralls,Incapacitated Hive Princes, Incapacitated Flotsam Scouts, Incapacitated Holy Servants, Incapcitated Wanderers,  Curious Hive Princes and both Veteran and Washed Up Holy Nation Soldiers.

description:
For Updates see change notes.

IMPORT REQUIRED (sorry)

Adds settlers of the Drifter faction that will visit your outpost when you have more than 10 people. They will ask to live at your outpost. If you accept they will wander around and do some shopping. 

They do not join your faction but are more like passive occupants.
Allowing them to join will give a boost (20) to your relationship with drifters.

They do not give you any benifit other than buying a little food, medicine, drugs and (hopefully) weapons. 

However they give your settlement a little life!

If you like this mod don't forget to give it a thumbs up
and if you feel extra supportive buy me a coffee [ko-fi.com] :-)

I still need to adjust the ai further it's not exactly what I want yet. 

POSSIBLE CONFLICTS - In order for this mod to work I have changed the ruined town of Bast from United Cities to Drifters - so that they have an 'HQ'. This shouldnt affect any vanilla gameplay but may conflict with any mods that alter BAST.

description:
Adds cats and string of cats to almost every character in the game, from Holy Nation Paladins to Empire Samurai, as well as Bandits, Swampers, Tech Hunters, Deadcats, Sheks, and many more. Also adds food to certain characters inventories, like farmers and bakers.

Allows you to, essentially, take your fallen enemies coin purse when you're done with them. The money a character is holding tends to be based on their profession and their combat level, so expect traders to be wealthier than guards or bandits.

Also reduces the weight of cats and string of cats by a factor of 100, so rich characters aren't encumbered.
